Jane’s dream is to own a wholesale shop where she can sell a variety of home products. She hopes to achieve her dream soon, despite the challenges of having inadequate capital.

Jane intends to use the loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.name: Helen's Group

texts.en:
Helen is a young Iraqi woman and leader of Helen's Group. She is 23 years old and married. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Helen is one of the many Iraqi women who are working from home, using their sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of their families.

Helen has five years' experience with sewing and tailoring and would like to improve the services she can offer to her customers. One of her priorities is to replace her old sewing machine with a newer model. To be able to do more creative jobs, she would also like to buy an over machine and nice, quality fabrics and raw materials to work with. To be able to make these purchases, she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. Relief International Microfinance Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and to buy an over machine and nice, quality fabrics and raw materials for her sewing business.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 37 years old, married, and blessed with four children between one to nine years old. For the last three years, she has bought and sold green tea leaves. Janeth makes a monthly income of 12,00 KES. 

Janeth is requesting a 10,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase more green tea leaves to sell. This is her first loan. Janeth will use the profit from her loan to support her business. She hopes to have a bright future and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase green tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 48 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elena has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elena requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Elena has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Trefa's Group

texts.en:
Trefa is a 28-year-old Iraqi woman. She is a married mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Trefa is one of the many Iraqi woman who works from home. She uses her sewing skills to generate income and participate in helping to meet the financial needs of her family.

Trefa has six years of experience with her small, home-based sewing and tailoring business. She makes women's and children's dresses and other small fabric household items. She has been able to provide her customers with quality products, but she would like to improve her work conditions and renew her work area to make her business more efficient. This is why she is taking a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor or apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to renew her work area to make her tailoring business more efficient.

loans.name: Doiphine

texts.en:
Doiphine is 27 years old and married. She and her husband Paul have two children ages 8 and 3 years old. She has a tailoring business that she has operated for 8 years in Tala town. She makes ladies' dresses, suits, and African attire for both men and women. The business has been profitable and it has enabled her to provide for the basic needs of her family.

This will be her first loan term with KADET LTD and she plans to use the amount to buy more sewing material for use in her business. She also plans to buy more tailoring equipment, such as sewing threads, needles, and scissors. She anticipates to generate more profit, with which she plans to buy an ironing board and more sewing materials.

Doiphine hopes to grow her business by supplying sewing materials to various tailoring shops, making more variety of clothes, and opening another tailoring shop in the area.

loans.use: to buy material and tailoring equipment.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 56 years old and married with seven children. One of her children is currently in school and Melba works very hard to provide for her family. For the past ten years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines where she sells a variety of items such as shampoo, eggs, canned goods, candies, groceries, and other products.

Melba is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, eggs, canned goods, candies, and groceries. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, eggs, canned goods, candies, and groceries

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
Novel's previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy all the needed products for her variety store. She also has a tricycle that she owns and oversees for additional income.  She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Novel is requesting her second loan for 12,000 PHP, which she will use buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell results in a better profit. Her profits help her to sustain her daily needs. 

Novel hopes to improve their way of living and that her business will continue to grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages.

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is a 39-year-old married man with seven children. He and his family live in Kasese, Uganda. 

Ahmed sells clothes and groceries. He earned his start-up capital from fishing, which he still practices.

Like most traders, he is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuations. His dreams are to educate his children and own a supermarket.

Ahmed intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 59 years old and a widow with children. She is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Along with her children, Rebecca manages her household while operating her variety store. She works hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for each item in the store. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP of cooking oil, or an egg. Rebecca makes a profit through buying wholesale supplies and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and community members and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in daily sales. 

Rebecca is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory and continue her business. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands. In the future, Rebecca hopes to have a successful and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from fellowship and studying the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Sheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty parlor business in the Philippine. Sheryl is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy cosmetic supplies for her beauty salon.

Sheryl has sustained her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic supplies for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an egg retail business in the Philippines. She has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Rhodora is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more eggs to sell. She will use her loan to build and expand her business. NWTF is re-listing Rhodora's business profile to support her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 39 years old and single with one child. For the past four years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling rice. Daisy works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF.

Daisy is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy stocks of soap, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and other products to sell. In the future, she hopes to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy soap, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, and other products

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 54 years old and married. He supports a family of six. For the last 31 years, Maurice has run a tailoring/dressmaking shop and he earns a monthly income of 5,000 KES. 

Maurice is requesting a 15,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase dressmaking materials such as fabric and assorted colored thread. This is his first loan. Maurice will use his anticipated profit to buy additional materials and supplies. In the future, he plans to educate his children and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dressmaking materials such as fabric and assorted colored thread

loans.name: Jose Ignacio

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de cocos, vive con su esposa y dos nietos, el negocio lo realiza desde hace cinco años, su horario es de 9:00am a 3:00pm, poco a poco se dio a conocer con la clientela, así ha consolidado el negocio, este surgió porque en su momento lo considero necesario para dar a su familia la subsistencia. 
Él necesita invertir un préstamo en la compra de cocos por mayoreo, tambien ocupara una parte del crédito para realizarle mejoras al coche en el que vende, con esto se le hará mas fácil para la vena, tambien mejorar las condiciones del coche. 
Su aspiración es tener la venta de cocos estable, tener la visión de agregar más productos derivados del coco.
texts.en:
José makes a living selling coconuts.  He lives with his wife and two grandchildren.  He has been in this business for the past five years, and he works from 9am to 3pm.  Little by little, he is making himself known to the customers, thereby strengthening his business.  In this moment, he considers it necessary to give his family what they need.

He needs to invest his loan in the purchase of coconuts wholesale.  He will also use a part of the loan to make repairs to the car he uses for selling.  This will make his sales easier.

His aspiration is to have stable coconut sales; he also has a vision of adding and selling more coconut products.

loans.use: to buy coconuts wholesale and to repair the vehicle he uses for his sales.

loans.name: Lindomar

texts.es:
Lindomar, vive con su familia, es acompañado, tiene un hijo de ocho años de edad, su esposa se encuentra en el extranjero, la ocupación de Lindomar es el comercio de madera y cultivo de maíz y frijol, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, lo aprendió a través de amigos, trabajando junto a él.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de madera para comercializar a los clientes, esto le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio, teniendo más capital para trabajar. Su objetivo es hacer a futuro su propia casa y comprarse un terreno, espera realizarlo a través de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Lindomar lives with his family, is in a relationship, and has an eight-year-old son.  His wife is abroad.  Lindomar works in the timber business and also grows corn and beans.  He has been doing this for five years, and learned from his friends, who work with him.

He is requesting a loan to buy wood to sell to customers.  This will help him strengthen his business, having more capital to work with.  His objective is to have his own house and land in the future; he hopes to make this dream come true through his work.

loans.use: to buy wood wholesale.

loans.name: Fouzia's Group

texts.en:
Fouzia is a 35-year-old independent woman. She is a responsible mother of four children, all of them are students. Her husband works at an agency business. She lives with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, Fouzia has been running a clothing business. She purchases clothing items from Multan and sells them in the market. Now she wants to open a new shop in her house so that she can increase her net income and savings. However, due to financial constraints, she finds it difficult.

As a member of a six-person lending group, she has requested a loan to purchase some furniture and clothing items. She dreams to provide a quality education to her children. She is hopeful that the loan will be productive for her business and family.

loans.use: To purchase furniture and clothing items for her new shop

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle repair shop in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing and Avon products. Elizabeth is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional materials for her motorcycle repair shop.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: Al-Asdqa Group

texts.en: Al-Asdqa is a group which is comprised of four women. They are from Haja, Yemen and work together to be able to help one another. They work to improve their families’ quality of life. Currently they are requesting a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB in order to increase their business levels. Aisha is the leader of the group. She is a 26-year-old single woman. She is a student at a technical institute, where she puts forth the effort necessary to be successful in life. She intends to use her portion of the loan to buy items for her home. She is requesting a youth loan of 30,000 YER to buy a kitchen cupboard for her house. In the future, she would like to own a business store to help her family.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen cupboard

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine is 36 years old. She lives in the Khoni District with her 18-year-old son. Ekaterine requested loans from local financial institutions several times in order to start an agricultural business, but did not have success. Her loan requests were rejected every time due to low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary Ekaterine earns working as a cook. Seasonally, the family sells the harvested nuts and maize that were grown on the family-owned land. It is hardly enough for the family to cover everyday expanses.  According to Credo estimations, the family belongs in the vulnerable poor category. Ekaterine requested a loan from Credo to start a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program loans money for business start-ups and "re-startups." It provides access to credit with less rigid conditions for the country's rural poor, who usually do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan, Ekaterine will purchase a milk cow. She will place it in the old, empty farm building located in their yard. Ekaterine will work hard on the farm. She will produce cheese and sell it in the village. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income. Their income will double, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Mariana Luz

texts.es: Mariana Luz vive junto a sus hijo en casa propia; ella posee una carpintería elabora muebles, sillas, mesas, bancos, entre otros , tiene varios años de tener el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en la materia lo que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar que califico como excelente para sus actividades comerciales, eso le ha ayudado a hacerse de mucha clientela pues  es una persona confiable al igual que la materia prima que utiliza, vende a precios accesibles y además el servicio es excelente; Mariana es una mujer emprendedora, visionaria siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que la lleven al éxito, quiere hacer crecer el negocio y planea invertir en este nuevo año que comienza, pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera por mayor, clavos, pintura, barniz etc. Mariana Luz tiene experiencia crediticia y muy buenas recomendaciones, tiene la certeza que podrá saldar su financiamiento y a la vez podrá darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
Mariana Luz lives together with her children in her own house; She has a carpentry shop where she makes furniture, chairs, tables, benches, and other things. She has had this business for several years and this has given her much experience in this field, which allows her to obtain the best earnings. Her business is located in a place she rated as excellent for her business. This has helped her to build a large clientele as she is a person that is reliable, just like the raw materials she uses. She sells at accessible prices and the service is excellent.

Mariana is an entrepreneurial woman and a visionary. She is always ready for new opportunities that will bring her success. She wants to make her business grow and plans to invest in the new year that just began, but she needs capital. That is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL, which will allow her to buy wholesale wood, nails, paint, varnish, etc. Mariana Luz has loan experience and very good recommendations. She is certain that she will be able to pay off her financing and at the same time she can give her family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: to buy wholesale wood, nails, paint and varnish

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea, quiere aumentar los productos en la venta de comida y necesita un préstamo para realizar esta inversión, comprara arroz, tomates, aceite, carne, pollo, repollo, entre otros productos necesarios, esto le permitirá a Andrea seguir brindando un buen servicio a los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior ella tuvo una experiencia buena, porque invirtió en el negocio y aumento su clientela, con sus ingresos ha podido cubrir las necesidades del hogar, todos está muy bien de salud en su familia.
texts.en:
Andrea wants to expand the food products she sells and she needs a loan to make the investment.  She'll buy rice, tomatoes, oil, meat, chicken, cabbage, and other necessary products.  This will allow Andrea to continue giving her customers good service.

She had a good experience with the previous loan because she invested in her business and increased her clientele.  With her income she has been able to cover her household needs.  Everyone in her family is in good health.

loans.use: to buy rice, tomatoes, oil, meat, chicken, and cabbage

loans.name: Claudia María

texts.es:
La señora Claudia Maria  es comerciante, originaria del municipio de san Rafael del sur, su actividad comercial es venta de ropa usada ambulante, tiene siete años de trabajar en esta actividad, es casada su esposo trabaja como transportista, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

solicita un crédito a ceprodel para la compra de una paca de ropa usada y materiales de construcción como azulejos y madera para mejora de la cocina; otra parte para invertirlo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Claudia María is a merchant from the town of San Rafael del Sur.  She's married and her husband works in transportation.  She has two school-age children.

Her business is selling used clothing as a street vendor.  She has done this work for seven years.

She's requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy a bundle of used clothing as well as construction materials such as tiles and wood to improve her kitchen.  She'll invest another part in her business.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothing and construction materials to improve her kitchen

loans.name: Francisco Adan

texts.es:
Francisco, se dedica a la venta de leña para panaderías y pupuseria, tiene 65 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene dos hijos los cuales están casados, uno le ayuda con remesas, Francisco tiene más de 30 años de poseer el negocio, trabaja de lunes a sábado durante la mañana y en la tarde ayuda a una hija a quien ayuda en la venta.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de leña al mayoreo, esto con el objetivo de tener la disponibilidad necesaria para atender a la clientela. Considera que lo que quiere es que el negocio este fortalecido, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco sells firewood to bakery shops and pupuserias (shops selling the Salvadoran specialty, pupusas). He is 65 years old and lives with his wife and two married children. One helps him with consignments..

Francisco has owned his business for more than 30 years. He works from Monday to Saturday during the morning. In the afternoon he helps his daughter, who helps with sales.

He is requesting a loan to buy firewood wholesale, with the goal of having the necessary inventory to fill his customers’ orders.  He wants his business to have a strong footing and to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy firewood wholesale..

loans.name: Elsy Marina

texts.es:
Elsy, se dedica a la venta de bisutería y ropa nueva, tiene tres hijos, el mayor trabaja y los otros dos estudian, el negocio lo realiza desde hace dos años, realizando la venta la cual aprendió por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de peluches, recuerdos, y toda la mercadería necesaria para la época de los enamorados, esto le ayudara porque tiene mucha demanda en este mes, aumentando sus ganancias.
Su sueño personal es poder construir la casa mas grande, haciendo las divisiones para que su familia este mas cómoda internamente.
texts.en:
Elsy makes her living selling costume jewelry and new clothing.  She has three children:  the oldest works, and the other two study.  She has had her business for two years.  She learned to sell out of necessity to improve her income.  

She is applying for a loan to buy plush toys, keepsakes and all the necessary merchandise for the season of lovers.  This will help her because she has a lot of demand this month that increases her earnings.  

Her personal dream is to be able to make her house bigger, adding room dividers so that her family is more comfortable inside.

loans.use: to buy plush toys and keepsakes.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
Américo es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel Secundario y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Chofer en la ciudad de El Alto y la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para pagar el costo de mantenimiento de su movilidad y así prestar un mejor servicio a la ciudadanía y mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Américo es tener su empresa de transporte urbano.

Es la Primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Américo’s single and has no children; he lives in his parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Villa Ingenio zone.  He completed secondary school and currently works as a taxi driver in the cities of El Alto and La Paz.  He needs the loan to pay to service his vehicle to provide better service to the people and improve his income.  His dream is to have his own urban transportation firm.  This is the first time he’s asked for IMPRO and KIVA loans.

loans.use: to service his taxi.

loans.name: Chepngetich

texts.en: Chepngetich, a 27-year-old single mother of two children aged ten and six years, does mixed farming involving both cash crops and dairy. She is applying for her first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD to purchase animal feeds. Chepngetich will use the anticipated profits to expand her business, and her  dream is to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds.

loans.name: Violy

texts.en: Violy, who is married, works hard to support her family. The owner of a salt retail business in the Philippines for 25 years, she has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of salt to sell. Violy would like to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of salt to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es: Dúo luz del sol, este grupo esta conformado por el señor Ervin quien se dedica a la sastreria o confeccion de trajes de vestir, tiene ya 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y gracias a Dios le ha ido muy bien, esta solicitando su segundo credito ya que esta bes nececita compra telas para elaborar los trajes, es por esa razon que esta solicitando este credito espera en Dios que le puedan brindar ese apoyo que el nececita para su negocio.
texts.en: Sr. Ervin is a member of Dúo Luz del Sol group. He is a tailor who makes formal wear. He has been engaged in the business for eight years and thanks God that it has gone well. He is requesting his second loan because of the need to purchase more fabric to make his goods.  He is looking to God to provide the support he needs for his business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics to make formal wear.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge es separado y  tiene cuatro hijos, vive en casa de sus familiares, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Río Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El estudió hasta el nivel Secundario y actualmente desempeña las funciones de Operador en una Empresa Textilera  en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, arnea, ladrillos, para refaccionar la casa donde vive y así tener un mejor nivel de vida.

El sueño de Jorge es tener su casita propia.

Es la Primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en: Jorge’s separated and has four children.  He lives in relatives’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Río Seco zone.  He studied up to secondary school and currently works as an employee in a textile firm in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy building materials and supplies like cement, sand and bricks to repair the house he lives in thus attaining a better standard of living.  Jorge’s dream is to own a house.  This is the first time he’s asked for credit from IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks to repair his house.

loans.name: Melvin Rolando

texts.es:
Melvin, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia, tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años de edad, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, con este trabajo ha ayudado a su familia, de lunes a sábado realiza su trabajo, lo aprendió con sus padres y tiene cinco años de trabajar en lo propio.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, y pago de mano de obra, esto para realizar todo el proceso adecuado de la siembra, contara con el dinero y será una ayuda para invertir y aumentar la productividad de la tierra.
Tiene deseos de mejorar económicamente, para darles a sus hijos un estudio universitario que se puedan preparar para una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Melvin is 27 years old and lives in his own home. He has two children who are 5 and 2 years old. He makes a living growing basic grains, with which he has supported his family. He works Monday-Saturday and learned from his parents. He has been working his own land for five years. 

He is requesting a loan so that he can purchase fertilizers, herbicides and pay for day labor. This is all done to adequately complete the planting process and will be a a great help to invest in and increase his land's productivity. He has a desire to improve his economic standing so that he can offer his children university level studies that will prepare them for a better life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pay for labor.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia de 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Sonia posee un negocio propio en su casa de habitación en donde comercializa cuadernos, papeles, lapiceros y otros más, así mismo vende artículos de regalo y juguetes y con el fin de poder contar con más ganancias también vende verduras y frutas de estación. Sonia es una señora muy amable y tranquila por lo que sus clientes se sienten muy a gusto adquiriendo sus productos. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda invertir en la venta de frutas y verdura debido a que este negocio es muy estable en donde obtiene ganancias diarias, por lo que desea aumentar su clientela comprando más verduras y más frutas lo que será de mucha ayuda para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two young children. Sonia has her own business at home where she sells notebooks, paper, pencil holders and other items. She also sells gifts and games and with the goal to have greater earnings, she also sells seasonal fruits and vegetables. Sonia is a very friendly and peaceful woman from whom her customers are very pleased to acquire their goods. 

She is requesting a loan from Integral with which she will be able to invest in the purchase of fruits and vegetables due to the fact that her business is very stable. She obtains daily earnings and wishes to increase her clientele by purchasing more vegetables and fruits which will be of great help to her home.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to then sell.

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame Fatoumata est âgée de  plus de 39 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants et réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Banconi, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Fatoumata après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente de calebasses il y’a environ 4 ans. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a quelque années. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association AMIDEF de Banconi), elle est à présent à son troisième prêt individuel et les deux prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter 10 colis de calebasses afin de les revendre  en détail à ses clientes composées d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Madam Fatoumata is more than 39 years old. She is married and mother to 3 children and lives with her husband and their children in Banconi, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

After having managed many businesses without success, Madam Fatoumata started buying and selling gourds about 4 years ago. Due to the concern of better satisfying her clientele which is growing more and more, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso several years ago. After several loans in solidarity (group loans) in a women's association in her neighborhood (Association AMIDEE in Banconi), she is currently on her third individual loan and the two previous loans were correctly repaid.

Thus, she is requesting this third loan to buy 10 parcels of gourds in order to resell them retail to her customers consisting of men and women.

With this loan she envisions making an average monthly profit of 95,000 FCFA which will be used to increase her business, contribute to the family's expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

loans.use: to buy gourds.

loans.name: Orledis

texts.es: Orleidis  de 21 años de edad se dedica a comercializar productos lácteos especialmente yogurt, queso y también vende carnes frías. Ella vive con su cónyuge y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad, al suroccidente de la ciudad donde tiene su mayor clientela   a quien el vende  al menudeo.  Su meta es aumentar el surtido para aumentar su potencial de ventas, pues conoce su negocio y le ha ido muy bien con lo que hasta el momento ha logrado. Sus ventas las realiza desde su casa, de donde sale diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana a distribuirlo y solo a las 7 de la noche deja de vender, mediante la modalidad de crédito y contado. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará yogurt por litros que tiene encargado y queso en mayor volumen, aprovechando que este último es un producto  de mayor consumo en los eventos festivos, pues sirve  como picadas y es la base de muchos alimentos que comúnmente la gente prepara para consumir o vender. Su meta es surtirlo y tener su propio local, para que algún día trabajando esmeradamente pueda alcanzar su sueño de prosperidad, que es el de comprar un apartamento.
texts.en:
Orleidis, 21, works selling dairy products, especially yogurt and cheese; she also sells cold cuts.  She lives with her spouse and little one-year-old son in the southwest of the city where most of her customers are; she sells to them at retail.  Her goal is to expand her stock to increase sales potential because she knows her business and has done very well with what she’s accomplished to date.

She sells from home heading out daily at 8 in the morning to distribute it and doesn’t stop selling until 7 at night; she sells both for cash and on credit.

She’s currently applying for a Kiva loan to buy yogurt by the liter she has on order and to buy larger amounts of cheese taking advantage of the fact that the latter is in high demand because it’s consumed during festive events because it’s served as a snack and is the base for many dishes people prepare to consume or to sell.  Her goal is to stock up with it and to have a shop of her own so that someday by working hard she’ll reach her dream of prosperity and be able to buy an apartment.

loans.use: to buy yoghurt by the liter and larger amounts of cheese.

loans.name: Irma Aracely

texts.es: Irma vive junto a su pequeña hija y su esposo con quien trabajan día con día para contar con todo lo necesario en el hogar. Irma es una persona muy trabajadora que cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte de las personas debido a que siempre ha sido vista desempeñando su rol de madre y proveedora de la mejor manera y con la mejor voluntad. Irma comercializa productos de belleza como cremas, perfumes, cosméticos, joyería e implementos para la cocina y en hogar en general, ella los vende de forma ambulante y desde su hogar, brindándoles el mejor servicio a todos sus clientes ya que siempre entrega los pedidos a tiempo y así mismo dando muy buenos precios.  Irma solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de cremas, perfumes, cosméticos y así mismo artículos para el hogar, de manera que sus ventas se incrementen y pueda tener un mejor negocio que le brinde mejores oportunidades en la vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Irma lives with her small daughter and her husband with whom she works day-to-day to be able to have everything that is necessary in their home. Irma is a very hard-working person who has very good references from people because she has always been seen performing her role as a mother and provider in the best manner and with the best will.

Irma sells beauty products such as creams, perfumes, cosmetics, jewelry and items for the kitchen and the home in general. She sells these items on foot and from her home, offering all of her clients the best service since she delivers orders on time and also offers very good prices. 

Irma is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with which she can buy a greater quantity of creams, perfumes, cosmetics, and household items so that her sales will increase and she can have a better business that offers better opportunities in the lives of herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and household items

loans.name: Dúo Rosas De San Juan Sac. Group

texts.es:
DÚO ROSAS DE SAN JUAN SAC.
Doña Magdalena de 30 años de edad líder  de este dúo,  tiene en su domicilio una tienda de venta de consumo diario desde hace vario años, entre los productos que ella  ofrece la venta de regalos, útiles escolares,  venta de refacciones, y venta de frutas, doña Magdalena requiere de  capital  en estos días para la compra de útiles escolares ya que  el ciclo escolar está a pocos días de iniciar y  sus clientes saben que en su negocio ella les brinda  una atención especial y a los mejores precios lo que ellas buscan para sus hijos. y tambien para la venta de productos comestibles, para su tienda para la venta.
texts.en:
ROSAS DE SAN JUAN SAC. DUO

Magdalena, 30, is this duo’s leader.  She’s had a grocery store at home for several years.  Among the things she sells are gift items, school supplies, refreshments and fruit.  Magdalena needs capital now to buy school supplies because the new school term is about to start and her customers know that she provides the special service and the best prices in her store that they seek for their children; she will also buy food items for her store.

loans.use: to buy food items and school supplies.

loans.name: Abigail Elizabeth

texts.es: Abigail de 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo con quien trabajan para salir adelante y vivir de manera estable. Abigail vive en casa propia y en donde se dedica a elaborar los platillos que comercializa, cada tarde ella sale al frente de su hogar para vender yuca frita y atol chuco el cual es una bebida caliente típica del país que se elabora de maíz fermentado, sal, frijoles y otros ingredientes más, este se acompaña de pan francés y chile y es una bebida que tiene gran demanda entre las personas. Abigail es una experta en lo que elabora por lo que posee varios clientes fijos que a diario se toman en tiempo para beber atol y comer yuca frita. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para elaborar el atol chuco, así también para comprar pan francés y chile, así mismo para comprar yuca por mayor y otras verduras, con lo que Abigail pueda aumentar la cantidad que realiza y de esta manera percibir más ganancias.
texts.en:
Abigail is 49 years old. She lives with her husband with whom she works in order to get ahead and live a financially stable life. Abigail owns her home where she makes the meals that she sells. 

Every afternoon she goes in front of her home to sell fried yucca and “atoll chuco”, which is a traditional hot drink in the country, made of fermented corn, salt, beans and other ingredients. This is a drink that is in high demand from customers and it is accompanied by French bread and chile. Abigail is an expert in food preparation and consequently has many steady customers who take the time every day to drink atoll and eat fried yucca.

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to buy the basic ingredients to make “atoll chuco” as well as French bread and chile and also to purchase yucca wholesale and other vegetables. Thus she can increase her inventory and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase  corn, bread and yucca to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Semillas De Esperanza Group

texts.es: Dúo Semillas de Esperanza, este duo esta conformado por la señora Lidia Oneida, de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos, ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 2 años, y esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos y asi seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: One member of "Dúo Semillas de Esperanza" (Seeds of Hope Duo) is Lidia Oneida, 21, who makes a living making and selling typical weaves. She has been doing this work for two years, and is requesting a loan for the purchase of material for the creation of weaves so that she can continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy material for the creation of typical weaves

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, ella  posee un taller de confección de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, elabora prendas como camisas, vestidos, pantalones, entre otros, el negocio está ubicado en el lugar de su residencia y tiene varios años de tenerlo, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las en la elaboración y venta además esta orgullosa de obtener las mejores ganancias; tiene ciertas ventajas ya que hay poca competencia y su negocio es el más conocido, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable, siempre se encuentra a la orden de las personas que la visitan; María es una mujer luchadora, dedicada a su labor, ama lo que hace y siempre está a la expectativa de oportunidades que le permitan sobresalir y llegar al éxito, una de sus metas es hacer crecer el negocio y ahora aprovechando el aumento de la demanda quiere invertir en materia prima pero necesita de capital por que sus compras las realiza al contado por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar tela por mayor, hilos, etc. María Magdalena es muy responsable y tiene excelentes referencias de crédito tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
María Magdalena lives with her life companion and their children in a house of her own.  She has a clothes making shop where she makes clothes for women, men and children.  She makes such items as shirts, dresses and pants, among others.  The business is located at home and she’s had it for several years.  She’s gained much experience manufacturing and selling and she’s proud of earning the best profits.  She has certain advantages in that there is little competition and her business is the best known.  She has a large clientele because people know that what she sells is top quality at affordable prices and service is unequaled; she’s always at her customers’ disposal.

María is a tenacious woman who is dedicated to her work; she loves what she does and is always on the lookout for opportunities that will let her stand out and attain success.  One of her goals is to make the business grow and taking advantage of current demand, she wants to invest in raw materials but needs capital to pay cash for her purchases which is why she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan to buy fabric at wholesale, thread, etc.  María Magdalena is very responsible and has excellent credit references; she’s certain that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time providing a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina es originaria del municipio de san Rafael es profesora de educación primaria,tiene treinta y cuatro años de laborar, es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos ya mayores de edad, una hija menor de edad estudia en la universidad.

solicita a ceprodel un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción: zinc, ladrillo y cemento para realizar mejoras en su vivienda. espera apoyo para poder lograr sus odjetivos de brindar un techo seguro a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is from the town of San Rafael.  She's an elementary-education teacher and has worked for 34 years.  She's a single mother with four adult children; a younger daughter studies in the university.

She's requesting a loan from CEPRODEL to buy construction materials to make improvements on her house: metal roofing, bricks, and cement.  She hopes for support to be able to achieve her objective of giving her family a safe roof.

loans.use: to buy metal roofing, bricks, and cement

loans.name: Jose Walter

texts.es: José Walter vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia, el  posee una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad granos básicos, desechables, aceite, pan, huevos, leche, jabones, entre otros, el negocio esta ubicado en un lugar que califico como muy bueno para sus actividades comerciales y tiene varios años de tenerlo, se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en las ventas y se siente orgulloso de que logro del trabajo porque le ha dado buenos resultados; tiene ciertas ventajas ya que hay poca competencia y su negocio es el más surtido de todos, ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de primera calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; José es un hombre luchador, dedicado a su labor, siempre está a la expectativa de oportunidades que le permitan sobresalir y llegar al éxito, uno de sus objetivos es hacer crecer el negocio y ahora aprovechando el incremento en las ventas quiere invertir en producto pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, producto instantáneo, golosinas, aceites, desechables, etc. José Walter es muy responsable, tiene excelentes referencias de crédito y esta muy contento con el apoyo, sabe que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
José Walter lives with his life partner in their own home. He owns a store where he sells staple products such as basic grains, disposable products, oil, bread, eggs, milk, and soap, among others. 

His business is located in a place which he believes is very good for commercial activity. He has had this business for several years. He has plenty of experience in sales and he is proud of his work because he has achieved good results. There are certain advantages to his business, such as the fact that he has little competition and that his business is the best stocked of all the stores. He has a large clientele because people know that everything he sells is of good quality and that he offers accessible prices. His service is also unbeatable. 

José is a fighter who is dedicated to his work. He always keeps an eye out for opportunities to stand out and achieve success. One of his goals is to grow his business. He would like to take advantage of an increase in sales by investing in products, but he needs capital. Therefore, he is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow him to buy staple grains, instant products, snacks, oil, disposable products, etc. 

José Walter is very responsible and has excellent references for this loan. He is very happy with this support and he knows that he will be able to pay off this debt while giving his family a good life.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, instant products, snacks, oil, and disposable products.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es:
Manuel, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, necesita invertir en la compra de  los materiales como abono, herbicidas, foliares, para mejorar su trabajo agropecuario, de esta manera espera obtener una buena producción.

Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo en su producción, en este tiempo ha permanecido trabajando para poder cubrir los gastos en estudio y alimentación de sus hijos, sus condiciones han mejorado.
texts.en:
Manuel makes a living cultivating staple grains. He needs to invest in the purchase of materials such as manure, herbicides, and fertilizer to improve his agricultural labor. In this way, he hopes to obtain better production.

His previous loan had a positive effect on his production. During this time, he has continued to work in order to cover the costs of education and food for his children, and his conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Safoura

texts.fr:
Née en 16 Février 1968 à Sikasso, Madame Safoura est une femme mariée, mère de trois enfants qui réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Banconi, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safoura n’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, s’est initiée il y’a environ quatorze années aux activités d’achat-vente des calebasses et des biscuits. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y’a quelques années avec laquelle elle a bénéficie de plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association AMIDEF de Banconi). elle est à présent à son troisième prêt individuel.
Elle sollicite ainsi ce troisième prêt individuel pour acheter 10 colis de calebasses  et 5 cartons de biscuits.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Elle dispose d’une place au niveau de marché de leur quartier où elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit avec une clientèle composée essentiellement des femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on February 16, 1968 in Sikasso, Madam Safoura is a married woman. She is mother to three children and lives with her husband and their children in Banconi, one of the outlying neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Madam Safoura, not having had the chance to go to school for social reasons, started buying and selling gourds and biscuits about fourteen years ago. She is very much requested especially by her clientele (consisting essentially of women) because of the quality of her products.

Due to the concern of better satisfying her clientele which is growing more and more, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso several years ago with which she has benefitted from several loans in solidarity (group loans) in an association of women of her neighborhood (Association AMIDEE in Banconi). She is currently on her third individual loan.

She is thus requesting this third individual loan to buy 10 parcels of gourds and 5 cartons of biscuits.

She has a stand at the market of their neighborhood where she sells her merchandise for cash and credit to a clientele made up essentially of women.

With this loan she envisions making an average monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on her loan and invest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy gourds and biscuits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy silk thread at wholesale.

loans.name: Jorge Alfredo

texts.es:
Jorge, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para fortalecer el taller de bicicletas, se comprara diferentes tipos de repuestos para la reparación de las bicicletas, como pedales, cadenas, forros.
El considera que en su negocio se encuentra fortalecido a través del uso de los prestamos, con las ganancias que le provee logra cubrir las necesidades a su familia.
texts.en: Jorge decided on a new loan because he needs more working capital to strengthen his bicycle repair shop.  He will buy various types of spare parts like pedals, chains and upholstery to repair bicycles.  He feels that his business is strengthened by means of loans and he’s able to use the profits he earns to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy pedals, chains and upholstery.

loans.name: Maria Estefana

texts.es:
MARIA ESTEFANA
ESTEFANA POSEE UN NEGOCIO DE COMPRA VENTA DE GALLINAS Y COMO ACTICIDAD SECUNDARIA CRIANZA Y ENGORDE DE GANADO VACUNO. ESTE ES SU SEGUNDO CREDITO KIVA QUE SOLICITA, EN EL ANTERIOR FUE BIEN PUNTUAL Y RESPONSABLE NO TUVO NI UN DIA DE ATRAZO, VA A ADELANTAR SU CREDITO, PORQUE ESTA ES LA EPOCA PARA CRIAR GALLINAS YA QUE ES TIEMPO DE VERANO Y ES LA FECHA ADECUADA PARA LA CRIANZA. ESTEFANA VENDE SUS GALLINAS EN EL MERCADO DE LA LOCALIDAD YA QUE SON MUY COMERCIABLES Y ES POR ELLO QUE QUIERE AUMENTAR SU PRODUCTO, ESTEFANA SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE GALLINAS Y CONCENTRADO PARA SU MANTENIMIENTO.
texts.en:
Maria Estefana has a business buying and selling chickens. As a second activity, she raises and fattens cattle. This is her second loan with Kiva. 

She was very responsible with her previous loan, which she paid back on time without a single day of delay. She is applying for this loan because this is the period in which she raises chickens. It is summer, which is the best time to raise them. 

Estefana sells her chickens in her town market. They are very marketable, which is why she would like to increase her production. She is applying for this loan to buy chickens and chicken feed for their care.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: Manuel Israel

texts.es:
Manuel, quiere continuar fortaleciendo el negocio, por eso se decide a seguir trabajando a través de préstamos, para comparar variedad de productos como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, pollo y condimentos.

El considera que los préstamos le ayudan para mejorar, con el anterior incremento su inventario en el negocio, obtuvo más ingresos por las ventas a los clientes, sus condiciones económicas son mejores a través del trabajo en el negocio.
texts.en:
Manuel would like to continue strengthening his business. Therefore, he has decided to continue working with loans in order to buy a variety of products such as sugar, rice, beans, chicken, and condiments.

He believes that loans help him to improve his business. He increased his business inventory with his previous loan and obtained more income from his client sales. His financial conditions are better because of his work in this business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, chicken, and condiments.

loans.name: Gloria Cristina

texts.es:
Doña gloria vive en la parte norte de la  cuidad de Managua. Tiene su negoción en su casa de habitación esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos básicos como arroz,azúcar,pasta dental ,jabón de lavar 
Aceita, gaseosa y productos perecederos para aumentar el inventario de su negocio, Ya que con esta inversión van a mejorar sus ingresos familiares.

Este le ayudara aprovechar la temporada y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Gloria lives in the north of Managua.  Her business is located at home.  She’s asking for a loan to buy basic staples like rice, sugar, toothpaste, laundry soap, oil, soft-drinks and perishable items to increase her store’s inventory because with this investment her family income will improve since this will help her take advantage of the season and earn higher profits.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, shirts, and undergarments.

loans.name: Mahmadkarim

texts.ru: Махмадкариму 46 лет. У него жена и трое детей. Он работает на железнодорожной станции. Жена Махмадкарима умеет вышивать национальные женские одежды. Однако у нее нет швейной машины. Махмадкарим хочет помочь жене в открытии дела. Он берет кредит на сумму 630 долларов для приобретения швейной машины. Прибыль с новой деятельности жены они будут копить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mahmadkarim is 46 years old.  He has a wife and three children.  He works at a railroad station.  Mahmadkarim's wife knows how to embroider traditional women's clothes.  However, she does not have a sewing machine.  Mahmadkarim would like to help his wife to open her business.  He is taking out a loan of 630 dollars for the purchase of a sewing machine.  They will save the profits from his wife's new business for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.ru: Абдурахмону 61 год. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. Абдурахмон владеет дехканским хозяйством, где работает его сын. Сам Абдурахмон хочет заняться животноводческой деятельностью. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму 1500 долларов для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. Абдурахмон хочет преуспеть в новом бизнесе и за счет его прибыли устроить свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Abdurahmon is 61 years old.  He is married and has four children.  Abdurahmon owns a farm where his son works.  Abdurahmon would like to start raising livestock.  He is asking for a loan of 1500 dollars for the purchase and resale of large horned livestock.  Abdurahmon would like to succeed in his new business and use the profits for his son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere fortalecer el negocio, se comprara medicina natural y química, como vitaminas, reconstituyentes, analgésicos, y otra variedad que le permita mejorar el negocio.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ya que compro mercadería y surtió el negocio, con ellos vendió más, pago las cuotas y cubrió los gastos del hogar, agradece por el financiamiento pues la ayuda a mejorar las condiciones de vida y económicas.
texts.en:
María’s asking for a new loan because she wants to strengthen her business.  She will buy natural and chemical medicines like vitamins, skin creams, analgesics and other varieties that will allow her to improve the business.

Her previous loan had a positive effect in that she bought merchandise and stocked the business leading to greater sales.  She made her payments and covered household expenses.  She’s grateful for the financing because it helps her improve her living conditions and her economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, pain-killers, etc.

loans.name: Jose Rogelio

texts.es:
José, está casado, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad, administra una pupuseria, este negocio surgió para tener una entrada de dinero para el hogar, el horario de venta es de 6:00am has las 6:00pm.
Actualmente José necesita fortalecer el negocio, por esto solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz, gaseosas, chicharrón, frijol, tambien mobiliario como unas mesas para atender a los clientes, este aporte le servirá para mejorar su inventario, las ventas y los ingresos.
Su meta a futuro es tener un negocio más rentable, realizarle mejorar a la vivienda, comprarse un vehículo para transportarse con su familia.
texts.en:
José is married and has two children, ages 14 and 18.  He runs a " pupusa" [stuffed tortillas] business, which he started because he needed money for the household.  His sales schedule is from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Currently José needs to strengthen his business, so he's requesting a loan to buy corn, soda, cracklings, and beans, as well as furniture such as some tables to serve the customers.  This support will help him improve his inventory, sales, and income.

His goals for the future are to have a more profitable business, make improvements on his house, and buy himself a vehicle to get around with his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, soda, cracklings, and beans

loans.name: Manuel Aurelio

texts.es:
El señor Manuel  Aurelio vive en Managua trabaja  en una empresa  como recaudador de impuestos, responsable y con muchos deseo de superación para su familia.

Manuel solicita un crédito para hacer pagos de universidad y compra de útiles escolares, sus sueños es brindar una buena educación para sus hijos, por ese motivo necesita un financiamiento que pueda solventar esos gastos.
texts.en:
Manuel Aurelio lives in Managua and works for a company as a tax collector.  He's responsible and has a great desire for self-improvement for his family.

Manuel's requesting a loan to cover university payments and to buy school supplies.

His dream is to give his children a good education, so he needs a loan to cover those expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition and school expenses

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.ru: Мухамади житель района Пяндж. Ему 51 год. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. Его сыновья работают заграницей. Мухамади имеет среднее техническое образование и несколько лет работал бухгалтером. Сейчас он хочет попробовать себя в животноводческой деятельности, так как это прибыльное дело. С этой целью он берет кредит для купли продажи крупно-рогатого скота. За счет прибыли с новой деятельности Мухамади хочет осуществить свою давнюю мечту - купить машину.
texts.en: Muhamadi lives in the Pyandj region.  He is 51 years old.  He is married and has four children.  His sons work abroad.  Muhamadi has a technical high school education and worked as an accountant for several years.  Now he would like to test himself in the livestock business, because this is a profitable business.  With this goal he is taking out a loan for the purchase and resale of large horned livestock.  Muhamadi would like to use the profits from the new business to realize his long held dream - to purchase a car.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: James' Group

texts.en: James is a fifty-three-year-old father of seven children and husband. James' current business is charcoal production, but he recognizes this venture as environmentally destructive and unsustainable. He therefore is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program to engage in a business that promotes tree planting. James intends to use the profits from his tree farm to educate his children, start a new business, and buy new land for his family to settle on.

loans.use: to purchase inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Abdulboqi

texts.ru: Абдулбоки житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 39 лет. Он женат и является отцом шестерых детей. Абдулбоки занимается растениеводством уже несколько лет. Однако теперь он хотел бы начать новый бизнес и попробовать себя в сфере животноводства. Поэтому он берет кредит для купли и продажи крупно-рогатого скота. Прибыль с нового бизнеса он использует для его расширения.
texts.en: Abdulboqi lives in the J. Rumy neighborhood.  He is 39 years old.  He is married and is the father of six children.  Abdulboqi has been a farmer for several years.  Now he would like to start a new business and test himself in the livestock sphere.  This is why he is taking out a loan for the purchase and resale of cattle.  He will use the profits from the new business to expand it.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Aijan

texts.ru: Айжан 35 лет, не замужем воспитывает 1 дочь. В 2010 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Айжан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве  со стартовой суммой в 30,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Айжан сумела развить свой бизнес с хозяйством, насчитывающем очень развитое хозяйство, ежемесячный доход составляет сумму около 20,00 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айжан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов мелкого скота. Доходы от кредита Айжан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Aijan is 35 years old, single, and raising one daughter. In 2010, Aijan was searching for a source of income for her family and started her livestock business with an initial investment of 30,000 KGS. Through perseverance and hard work, Aijan has been able to expand her business and turn it into a highly developed farm.  Her monthly income is about 20,000 KGS. In order to further expand her business, she has turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy additional small livestock. Aijan plans to invest income from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: purchase more sheep.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Lolita earns more income from food vending.

Lolita is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc. for her ready-to-wear business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Jospeh

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old, married, and supports a family of seven. He runs a school facility, and he has done this for the last four years making a monthly income of 26,000 KES. 

He has applied for his first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD which he plans to use to build more classrooms for his school. 

The anticipated profits will support the expansion plans. His future dreams are for the prosperity of his business.

loans.use: to build more classrooms

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en: Athanasie is a 52-year-old woman from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  She is also a shopkeeper and will reinvest the money she makes into expanding her other business to earn more money for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin is a 44-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia is 62 years old and single.

Lucresia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, etc.

Lucresia has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Lucresia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Adidas

texts.en: Adidas is a 40-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Fayzidin

texts.ru:
Файзидин проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 24 года. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Файзидин очень хороший молодой человек. У него среднее образование. 
Файзидин вот уже четыре года занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. Он в основном занимается садоводством. Файзидин сажает фруктовые деревья. Он берет кредит для приобретения саженцев. Он намерен копить деньги для проведения свадьбы брата в будущем.
texts.en: Fayzidin lives in the Jilikul region.  He is 24 years old.  He is married.  His wife is a homemaker.  Fayzidin is a very good young man.  He has a high school education.  Fayzidin has been growing crops for four years.  He mostly farms an orchard.  Fayzidin plants fruit trees.  He is taking out a loan to buy saplings.  He is determined to save money for his brother's future wedding.

loans.use: to buy saplings

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.ru: Боймуроду 56 лет. Он женат, отец пятерых детей. Его старший сын уехал на заработки в заграницу. Сам Боймурод вот уже 10 лет занимается животноводством. Он покупает крупно-рогатый скот, откармливает его и затем продает на рынке своего города с наценкой. Боймурод хотел бы расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом для закупа скота.
texts.en: Boymurod is 56 years old.  He is married and is the father of five children.  His oldest son moved to earn money abroad.  Boymurod has been raising livestock for 10 years.  He buys and resells cattle, he fattens it and then sells it at the market in his city with a mark up.  Boymurod would like to expand his business and earn a good profit.  With this goal  he requested a loan for the purchase of livestock.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Deysi Yanira

texts.es: Deysi Yanira vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa propia; ella se dedica a la  venta de pan y tiene en variedad, pan francés y dulce,  quesadillas, salpores, pastelitos, tortas entre otros, es muy conocida en la zona pues vende el pan más exquisito del lugar, el negocio esta ubicado en una zona que califico como excelente para su actividad comercial y se siente muy satisfecha al ver que las personas se van contentas del lugar, todo lo que vende es de primera calidad, y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, anteriormente comerciaba con productos de uso personal pero decidio probar suerte con la venta de pan y le ha traido muy buenos resultados; Deysi es una mujer visionaria con muchas ganas de ganarse un futuro más próspero, piensa que si tiene un comienzo tendrá la lucha y si tiene la lucha lograra la victoria, ahora está buscando la lucha y quiere acrecentar el negocio pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar pan francés y pan dulce por mayor etc. Deysi Yanira es muy responsable y con un buen record crediticio tiene confianza que podrá saldar la deuda pero sobre todo tiene esperanza que podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deysi Yanira lives with her three children in her own home. She works selling bread, and offers a wide variety of bread and pastries, cakes, cookies, biscuits, and other products. She is very well known in the area because she sells the most delicious bread in town. Her business is located in an area she referred to as excellent for her business endeavor, and she feels very satisfied to see her customers leave happy. Everything she sells is top quality and her prices are affordable. Service is also excellent.

She used to sell personal products but decided to venture into selling bread, and has obtained very positive results. Deysi is a visionary woman who is very eager to achieve a more prosperous future for herself. She believes that where there is a start, there is a struggle, and that striving through that struggle she will achieve her goals. Now is her time to strive, and she wants to increase her business, but she needs capital. That is why she is requesting a loan from Integral, which will allow her to purchase wholesale bread and pastries, etc. 

Deysi Yanira is very responsible and has good credit history. She is confident that she will be able to pay back her debt, and most of all, she is hopeful that she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bread and pastries.

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en: Fortune is a 23 year old woman from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. She is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which she will resell to people without electricity in her village. Every week or so, these customers will return to her to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  With the money she makes from selling and recharging lights, she will pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula, junto a su esposo y dos de sus hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, y hace dos años que inicio realizando trabajos de manualidades, bisutería (hace aretes, pulseras, anillos) y venta de joyas de plata como aretes, cadenas, anillos y otros. Además obtiene otros ingresos por cuidar a dos niños de una vecina. Ha decidido solicitar este préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para invertirlo en el negocio, va comprar piedras, hilos, alambres, hules, ganchos de aretes, anillos para elaborar productos de bisutería. El préstamo le ayudara a mantener producto y a cumplir con los pedidos hechos. Su plan es ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y ayudar a su hijo que tiene problemas de salud.
texts.en: Ana, 46, is married and has four children; she lives in a suburban neighborhood in San Pedro Sula with her husband and two of her children.  She’s always been a merchant and two years ago started making crafts and costume jewelry (she makes earrings, bracelets, and rings) and also sells silver jewelry items like earrings, chains, rings and others.  She also earns income caring for one of her neighbor’s children.  She’s decided to request this 15,000 Lempira loan to invest in the business.  She’s going to buy gemstones, thread, wire, rubber, earring hooks and rings to manufacture her costume jewelry.  The loan will help her produce and fill pending orders.  Her plan is to help her husband with household expenses and help her son who has health problems.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry making supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Bethel Group

texts.es: Dúo Bethel, Angela tiene 60 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales ya todos estan casados por ese motivo ella ya se encuentra sola viviendo en su casita, y tiene una tienda de productos comestibles desde hace años, ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para su tienda ya que nececita tener mas bariedad para ofreserles a sus clientes.
texts.en: Angela is a member of the Dúo Bethel community bank group. She is 60 years old and has 5 children, all of whom are married, which is why she lives alone in her house. She has had a small store for many years where she sells groceries. She is requesting a loan to buy grocery products for her store because she needs to be able to offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es: Ana siempre se ha destacado por esforzarse lo más posible para salir adelante y darle todo lo necesario a sus dos hijas. Ana se dedica a la venta de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo comercializa zapatos y sandalias, y cosméticos, su negocio esa ubicado en su casa de habitación donde sus hijas le ayudan a atender a las personas, mientras Ana sale a vender de forma ambulante para mejorar sus ganancias. El deseo de Ana es poder comprar ropa en mayores cantidades y así obtenerla a menores precios y mucho más surtida en tallas y colores, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más ropa, cosméticos y zapatos. De esta forma Ana espera mejorar sus ganancias, brindando mejores precios lo que le permita ser preferida por las personas.
texts.en:
Ana has always stood out for making the maximum effort to get ahead and give her two daughters everything they need.

Ana makes a living selling clothing for men, women, and children.  She also sells shoes, sandals, and cosmetics.  Her business is located in her house, where her daughters help her wait on people while Ana goes out to sell on foot to improve her profits.

Ana wants to be able to buy clothing in large quantities to get better prices and a much better assortment of sizes and colors.  This is why she's requesting a loan from Integral, to have the money she needs to buy more clothing, cosmetics, and shoes.

This way Ana hopes to improve her profits, giving better prices, which is why people prefer her.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is a 45-year-old married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Solomon operates a bar where he sells beer, soda, and milk. He also trades in agricultural products like maize and beans. 

He started with a small amount of capital, and over time his business has picked up, with now over six million UGX worth of stock. He has challenges of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the people’s demands. 

Solomon is very committed to educating his children, despite the limitation in finances. Solomon is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Uul

texts.ru: Уул 43 год,замужем, имеет 4 детей.Старшая дочка  студентка. Уул в течении многих лет работает медсестрой в местной больнице.
