Несмотря на все проблемы они остаются, все такой же жизнерадостной и веселой. Она твердо уверена в светлое будущее своей семьи. Уул в качестве основного источника дохода для семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Уул сумела развить свой бизнес с 9,000 KGS сегодня ежемесячный доход бизнеса составляет 3,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 коровы и теленка, для увеличения дохода от продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Уул планирует вложить в  увеличения количества скотины. Она мечтает чтобы дети имели хорошую работу в будущем и хорошую семью.
texts.en: Uul is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Her eldest daughter is a college student.  Uul has worked as a nurse at the local hospital for many years. Despite all of her problems, she is cheerful and fun. She firmly believes in her family's bright future. A major source of income for the family is Uul's work in animal husbandry.  Through perseverance and hard work, Uul was able to start her business with 9,000 KGS.  Currently, her monthly income from the business is 3,000 KGS. In order to further develop her business, Uul turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan 100,000 KGS to buy one dairy cow and a calf so that she can increase her revenue from selling milk. Uul plans to invest her income from the loan into increasing her number of cattle. She dreams that, in the future, her children will have good jobs and good families.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow and calf

loans.name: Nyanje's Group

texts.en:
Nyanje is a forty-two-year-old father of fourteen. Nyanje's primary income-generating activity is tapping coconut trees for the natural wine they produce; he also engages in other agricultural activities for bringing income to his family. Coconut wine is widely produced, therefore making the supply high and the prices low. 

Nyanje's other agricultural activities are challenged by drought, causing poor harvest yields. He is joining the KOMAZA tree planting program because he believes "the project really targets to improve the lives of the people." With the proceeds he will get from harvesting his trees, Nyanje wants to provide education through university level for his children, as well as build a good home for his family and start other businesses. Nyanje says that because the KOMAZA tree planting program is so good, he "would love to see everyone in Mwanamwinga registered for it."

loans.use: to purchase tree farm inputs such as eucalyptus seedlings and fertilizer, as well as to pay for technical trainings and tree farm maintenance support

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo dos hijos, ella vive en el municipio de Nueva frontera, Santa Bárbara. Hace 5 años que ella tiene su propio negocio de una pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar. Vende manteca, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, embutidos, carne de pollo, maíz productos enlatados, churros, pastillas, etc. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando que es por 10,000 lempiras, quiere surtir más el negocio para competir y aumentar su clientela. Comprara carne de pollo, embutidos, maiz, frijoles, manteca y otros abarrotes. Ella tiene como meta comprar vitrinas de vidrio para exhibir productos.
texts.en: Sonia, 33, is a single mother; she has two children in her care.  She lives in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  She’s had her own grocery store business for five years now where she sells basic family staple items like lard, sugar, rice, beans, cured meats, chicken, corn, canned goods, snacks, pills, etc.  She will use the 10,000 Lempira loan she’s requesting to better stock the store to compete and increase clientele.  She will buy chicken, cured meats, corn, beans, lard and other grocery items.  Her goal is to buy glass cases to display products.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en: Kellen is a 26-year-old hard working, single woman living in Kyenjojo-Uganda. She operates a lady’s beauty salon working at least 7 hours a day, and rears goats to earn extra income.  The customers' different tastes and preferences pose a challenge to her business growth due to inadequate capital.    Kellen is requesting a loan to purchase 2 hair driers and sinks for the salon.

loans.use: to purchase 2 hair driers and sinks for the salon.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Né en Novembre 1964 à Doumanani préfecture de Sikasso, Monsieur Souleymane  est polygame avec 2 femmes et père 11 enfants résidant avec sa famille à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Souleymane après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initié il y’a environ deux ans aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à la vente de bois de chauffes qu’il achète à Denderso et environnants. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses bois. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son quatrième prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce quatrième prêt, il compte acheter 10 chargements de camion “10 tonnes” de bois de chauffe. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born in November 1964 in the Doumanani prefecture of Sikasso, Mister Souleymane is polygamous with 2 wives and is father to 11 children who live with his family in Hamdallaye, one of the popular neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

After having managed several businesses without success, about two years ago Mister Souleymane started businesses which generate revenue, notably the sale of firewood which he buys in Denderso and surrounding areas. He is much requested by his clientele for the quality of his wood. To satisfy his clientele which is growing more and more, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which he is on his fourth individual loan and all the previous loans were correctly repaid.

With this fourth loan he plans to buy 10 "10 ton" truckloads of firewood.

With this loan he envisions making a monthly profit of 150,000 FCFA which will be used to contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on his loan and invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy truckloads of firewood.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 29 years old, married, and has two children who are both in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elsa requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Elsa has been in this business for three years.  In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Wariti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Zaina, vice présidente du groupe de crédit Wariti. Veuve, femme dynamique, ambitieuse, entrepreneur autodidacte, âgée de 48 ans, mère de 7 enfants. Elle est vendeuse des poissons. Son mari fut décédé inopinément d’une courte maladie. Elle a commencé son business avec un micro crédit reçu de l’IMF Hekima. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 9 cycles de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires régressent suite à l’insécurité grandissante dans les zones d’approvisionnement, précisément dans Rutshuru. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 paniers de poissons (sales, fumés ou frais). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et acheter une maison. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en: The client Zaina is vice president of the credit group Wariti. She is a widow, a dynamic woman, ambitious, a self-taught entrepreneur, 48 years old, and mother to 7 children. She sells fish. Her husband died unexpectedly from a short illness. She started her business with a micro loan received from the MFI Hekima. However, she has just completed 9 loan cycles. During this period, this client saw her business regress following the growing insecurity in the supply zones, specifically in Rutshuru. This new loan must serve to supply her with 3 baskets of fish (salted, smoked or fresh). In addition, she hopes to see her children grow and to buy a house. The client thanks Hekima for its actions empowering poor women excluded from traditional banking.

loans.use: to buy 3 baskets of fish (salted, smoked or fresh).

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 28 años de edad, casada, tiene dos hijos, vive con su familia en  San Pedro Sula, Cortes. Sandra tiene un puesto de venta en un mercado de la ciudad, que hace un año vende rosquillas, empanadas, tustacas, dulces y tabletas. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio.  Ella ha decidido obtener este préstamo que es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar más producto y surtir el negocio.  Su sueño es que el negocio crezca para poder comprar su propia casa y un vehículo para el negocio.
texts.en: Sandra, 28, is married and has two children; she lives with her family in San Pedro Sula, Cortes.  Sandra has a food stall in one of the city markets.  For the last year she’s been selling ‘rosquillas’ and ‘tustacas’ [traditional cookies], turnovers, candy and tablets.  She’s always been a merchant.  She’s decided to get a 10,000 Lempira loan to buy more products to stock the business. Her dream is that the business grows to be able to buy her own house and a vehicle for the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her food market.

loans.name: Ofelia Carolina

texts.es:
Doña Ofelia carolina vive en la cuidad de Managua casada  tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación  venta de ropa  y brinda los servicio de fotografía  profesional.

Esta solicitando un crédito  para la inversión de uniforme escolares, zapato, para ofertarles a sus cliente  ya que la demanda de esos productos aumentan con el inicio del año escolar. 


espera aumentar sus ingresos con mejor ganancias para seguir dando lo necesario a para su familia.
texts.en:
Ofelia Carolina lives in the city of Managua and is married. Her business is located in her home where she sells clothing and works as a professional photographer. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase school uniforms and shoes to offer her clients since the demand for these products increases at the beginning of the school year. 

She hopes to increase her income so she can continue providing for her family.

loans.use: purchase school uniforms and shoes

loans.name: Ma. Emily

texts.en:
Ma. Emily is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a direct-selling business, selling Avon and MSE products, in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like shoes, belts, dresses and perfumes.

Ma. Emily has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF, before this loan. She has been running the direct-selling business for eight years, and she also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal and firewood.

Ma. Emily aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like shoes, belts, dresses and perfumes

loans.name: Festo

texts.en: Festo is a 29-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ana Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque quiere invertir más en el negocio y tenerlo más surtido, comprara huevos, arroz, queso, aceite, sodas, refrescos, boquitas, entre otro tipo de productos que le permitirán mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Comenta que con el préstamo anterior le ha permitido tener un negocio surtido, tener nuevos productos y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, en su familia manifiesta que viven en mejor condición.
texts.en:
Ana has decided to request a new loan because she wants to invest more into her business, to have a better selection of products. She will use the loan to buy eggs, rice, cheese, cooking oil, sodas, juices and snacks as well as other things. This will allow her to improve the service she provides to her customers.   

She told us that the previous loan allowed her to offer a variety of products in her store, to offer new products and to satisfy the demand of her customers. It also resulted in the quality of life improving for her family.

loans.use: to buy eggs, rice, cheese, cooking, sodas, juices and snacks.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 24 years old, married and supports a family of four. For the past four years she has been selling green tea leaves, earning a monthly income of KES. 11,000.

Now requesting her first loan of KES. 10,000 from KADET LTD to buy more green tea to sell, Sharon will use the anticipated profits to support her business. Her future plan is to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase green tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскуль 37 лет, замужем, они с мужем воспитывают 2 детей. Основной деятельностью семьи Рыскуль является животноводство. В 2006 году, Рыскуль решила заняться и откормом и перепродажей скота, вложив в первоначальный закуп скотины 40,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, хозяйство Рыскуль приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 10,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рыскуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и телят. Доходы от кредита Рыскуль планирует направить на будущее детей. Она мечтает приобрести квартиру для сына.
texts.en: Ryskul is 37 years old, married, and she and her husband have two children. Ryskul's family's primary occupation is animal husbandry. In 2006, Ryskul decided to start fattening and reselling cattle.  She invested 40,000 KGS in her initial purchase of cattle . At present, the farm brings Ryskul a monthly income of 10,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm, Ryskul asked the company Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase cows and calves.  Ryskul plans to affect her children's future with income from loan. She wants to buy an apartment for her son.

loans.use: purchase cows and calves

loans.name: Gantomor

texts.en:
Mrs. Gantomor is 45 years old and lives with her husband and son in a house in Sainshand soum (district) in Dornogobi province of Mongolia. Her husband, Ganbaatar, age 48, works at a local communication company as a driver. Her son, Bayanjargal, age 23, has graduated university and stays home looking for a job now. 

Gantomor has been running a butcher shop since 2005 at a rental counter of the local market. She has built a close relationship with herders and customers over the years. 

Gantomor is now requesting 1,200,000 MNT to purchase from herders a large amount of meat products to sell to local customers. She is a hardworking, diligent and modest woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of meat products from herders, and sell to local customers.

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie is 36 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with eight children.
Bernie has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately 5000 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase materials for her motorcycle transport business.
Bernie has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Bernie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Nargizi

texts.en:
Nargizi is 35 years old. She lives in Mtskheta District with her husband and 2 children. Nargizi requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times, for the family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and her family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is Nargizi’s salary working as a teacher at a local school. She makes totally 320 Laris per month. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the poor subsistence category. 

Nargizi requested a loan from Credo to start-up the family business. Her loan request was approved by the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit Nargizi will purchase calves. After purchasing calves they will raise them and produce dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Diappalante Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Diappalanté regroupe 3 hommes et 2 femmes qui se sont unis depuis plusieurs années déjà. Parmi les activités qui existent dans le groupement il ya l’élevage, la vente de vaisselle, draps, portables, produits cosmétiques et produits alimentaires. Concernant leur responsable, la dame Khardiata,agée de 48 ans, elle s’active dans l’élevage depuis 7 ans maintenant. Avec le crédit, elle désire diversifier ses produits. Madame Khardiata ne supporte pas de charges familiales et  travaille à améliorer son activité.
 Dans l’avenir, elle désire améliorer  et diversifier son métier afin de toucher plus de clients.
texts.en:
The credit group Diappalanté groups together 3 men and 2 women who united themselves several years ago already. Among the businesses that exist in the group there is breeding, selling dishes, sheets, cell phones, cosmetic products and foodstuffs. The leader, the woman Khardiata who is 48 years old, has been active in breeding for 7 years now. With this loan, she would like to diversify her products. Madam Khardiata does not support any family dependents and works to improve her business.

In the future, she wants to improve and diversify her business in order to reach more customers.

loans.use: to improve and diversify her products.

loans.name: Sainsanaa

texts.en:
Mr. Sainsanaa, 37 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house which was built last autumn. In June 2012 he began running newspaper, magazine and mobile phone sales, renting a shop at a trade center. 

Currently his wife is operating this shop because in October 2012 he began purchasing heads and intestines of livestock from brokers and then cleaning and classifying them. In the end he sells them to customers and some outdoor markets. Also he uses some of them in his family's daily food. One time he said that by using livestock intestines in food, the family really decreased their food expenses significantly. Even though he has been running his intestine sales business for just three months, he has already attracted quite a number of clients. 

The house they live in is incompletely built and in wintertime, it really loses its heat, and as a result the family gets chilled to their core. The house needs its roof to be covered with metal, walls to be insulated both from inside and outside, and floors to be molded. So Sainsanaa is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase metal, glass cotton, bricks and cement. As a result, the family will be able to live in a comfortable and warm place and most importantly, the house will preserve its energy and enable the family to burn less coal, thus contributing to the effort against air pollution.

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who greatly cares about his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase glass cotton, bricks, cement and metal

loans.name: Theonest

texts.en: Theonest is a 48-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself, his wife, and their children.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 34 years old, comes from Nakuru, and is married with two children who are aged six and 10 years old.

Leonard has a transport business and also owns rental houses as a secondary business that he has been running for the past five years and with a good income. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy iron sheets for the rental houses that he is building. 

He hopes to own more rental houses in the near future and expand his transport business.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don Jose, tiene  62 años de edad, casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive con su esposa y dos de sus hijos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. Don José toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura tiene aproximadamente 35 años de experiencia. Produce café, maíz y frijoles.  Su producción mayor es de café y lo vende en el mercado local. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo  por 20,000 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento a la finca y tecnificar la producción. Va comprar fertilizantes para preparar la tierra, utilizara para limpieza, siembra y pago de corte de sus cultivos. Tiene como meta, ampliar el cultivo y en lo personal construir su casa de bloque.
texts.en: José, 62, is married and has three children.  He lives with his wife and two of his children in a village belonging to the municipality of Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  José has spent his entire life working in agriculture; he has approximately 35 years’ experience.  He grows coffee, corn and beans.  His coffee production is the largest and he sells it in the local market.  He’s decided to request a loan for 20,000 Lempiras to provide farm maintenance and add technological advances to production.  He’s going to buy fertilizer to prepare the soil and will use the loan also to pay for the weeding, planting and pruning.  His goal is to expand the crops and also has the personal goal of building his house with concrete blocks.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a 38-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, es un agricultor, vive con su familia conformada por su esposa y sus hijos, solamente él trabaja realizando las siembras de granos básicos, este proceso lo aprendió junto con sus padres trabajando diariamente, en la actualidad realiza sus propios cultivos para el sustento de su familia, no tiene un horario establecido para realizar las labores.

José, tiene la necesidad de invertir más en la agricultura, porque se dispone a realizar la nueva siembra de la temporada, para esto quiere un préstamo que le ayude a trabajar con los recursos, como la compra abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, tambien preparar la tierra.
El considera que este aporte le ayudara a que su cultivo sea mejor en producción, sus circunstancias en la familia serán mejor, porque contaran con una fuente de ingreso y de alimento en la agricultura.
texts.en:
José is a farmer, he lives with his family, which is made up of his wife and their children. He works planting crops of basic grains. He learned this type of work from his parents, working with them on a daily basis. He currently has his own crops to sustain his family. He does not have a set work schedule in which he does his work. 

José needs to invest more in his farming so that he can plant a new crop this season. This is why he has requested a loan, which will help him to work with resources, like fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and also to cover the costs of preparing the land. 

He believes this contribution will help him so that his crop will have a better yield and that his family's circumstances will improve because they will have a new source of income as well as more food from the harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Frederic

texts.en: Frederic is a 54-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself, his wife, and their children.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Wilder Nahum

texts.es: Wilder,  tiene 22 años de edad, soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Nueva frontera.  Wilder se dedicaba a estudiar y sus padres le cedieron el negocio  para que el lo administre. El negocio es de pulpería y tiene tres años de experiencia, donde vende azúcar, arroz, pan, café, maíz, frijoles, manteca, churros, pastillas, papel  higiénico, jabón, champú, etc.  Él esta solicitando a ODEF su primer préstamo de 11,000 Lempiras con el cual va invertir en productos alimenticios como azúcar, maíz y frijoles.  Su objetivo es incrementar el inventario de productos para la venta. Su sueño es comprar una motocicleta para viajar personalmente a comprar los productos de la pulpería.
texts.en: Wilder, 22, is single living with his parents and siblings in a village belonging to the municipality of Nueva Frontera.  Wilder was a student and his parents ceded him their business so he’d manage it.  The business is a grocery store and he now has three years’ experience.  He sells sugar, rice, bread, coffee, corn, beans, lard, snacks, pills, toilet paper, soap, shampoo, etc.  He’s asking ODEF for his first, 11,000 Lempira, loan to invest in food items like sugar, corn and beans.  His goal is to increase his inventory of items for sale.  His dream is to buy a motorcycle so he can travel personally to buy the products for the grocery store.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 24 years old, single and supports his two sisters.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 40,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to increase his mobile money business floats (electronic credits). The anticipated profits will educate her sisters. 

His future dream is to have better family living standards and a quality education

loans.use: To increase mobile money business floats (electronic credits).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck load of plantains.

loans.name: Eduvejes

texts.en:
Eduvejes is 69 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 
Eduvejes has a store and sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately 2,500.00 PHP each month doing this work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional groceries and other consumable products for her retail business.
Eduvejes has been a member of PMPC for almost four years. In the future, Eduvejes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries and other consumable products

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 62 years old. He lives in Khoni District, West Georgia, with his wife. His wife receives a retirement pension. George is leading his family's small-scale agricultural business. He runs a family-owned dairy farm, with two calves and a milk cow. George produces cheese and sells it in the village. In addition, he grows nuts and maize on the family-owned land, and he sells these crops seasonally. The income is not enough to provide George and his wife with normal living conditions. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

George has requested loans from local financial institutions several times, for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected every time, because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

George requested a loan from Credo to restart his family business, which was stopped a couple of years ago because of financial problems. His loan request was approved, as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with fewer conditions, to the country's rural poor, for business start-ups and restart-ups. This population is often considered "high risk borrowers" because of low incomes, and they often do not have access to credit.

With the credit, George will purchase chickens to restart a poultry farm. He will place the chickens in a shed located in their yard. He will raise them and sell them for a higher price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to restart-up a poultry farm

loans.name: J. Pierre

texts.en: J. Pierre is a 34-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a 53-year-old, married woman, from Ubay, Bohol. Merlinda has run a sari-sari (variety store) business for more than 20 years. She sells various goods and items to the people in her area. This is the source of her income.

Merlinda is asking for a loan to buy additional items to resell, like canned goods, candies, rice, snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this better inventory, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her inventory, like canned goods, rice, snack foods, soap and toiletries

loans.name: María Nidia

texts.es:
María Nidia de 39 años, es madre soltera de un niño de 13 años de edad, radicada en la vereda el pescado del municipio de Valdivia, Colombia. Desde hace doce años se dedica a la venta de mecatos en un pequeño local ubicado cerca de los balnearios del municipio, razón por la cual resulta un punto estratégico para la venta, debido a que este lugar es zona turística y es muy visitado por residentes y foráneos de toda la región.
Motivada por el flujo de personas, esta mujer quiere expandir su negocio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de un computador para mejorar el sonido e incrementar la variedad de música de su negocio, para mejorar sus ventas.
María sueña con ver crecer su negocio, permitiéndoles mejorar su condición de vida y ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor educación.
texts.en:
María Nidia, age 39, is a single mother, and she has a 13 year old child.  She resides in Vereda El Pescado in the Valdivia municipality in Colombia.

She has been selling snacks for 12 years.  She sells at a small location close to the resorts in the municipality.  The reason she is there is that it is a strategic sales location.  This is a tourist place, and it is very popular with locals and people from the entire region. 

Motivated by the flow of people, this woman wants to expand her business.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy a computer.  She wants the computer to enhance the audio and to increase the variety of music in her business in order to improve sales.

María dreams of seeing her business grow.  This will allow her to improve her living conditions and to provide her child with a better education.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn manages a 'sari-sari' store in their village. She usually sells commodities that are often sold in their village like spices, breads and canned goods. 

Evelyn has been in this business for six years. Her income from the business mostly goes for her two children's allowances in school.

Evelyn's husband is a farmer. His sales from farming are used to pay their children's fees in school. Evelyn wants to increase her income from her business so as to be able to cover their family's basic needs daily. She is requesting a loan of P35,000 to buy soft drinks, coffee and sugar. She will manage the business well and work hard for the growth of it.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, coffee and sugar.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, está iniciando un nuevo trabajo en la agricultura, para esto comprara los insumos necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, y solicita un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra, con este aporte estará iniciando con todos los insumos.
Considera que su trabajo en la agricultura está mejorando, con los materiales agrícolas que aplica, ya que tiene todo lo necesario para trabajar y crecer, con su familia ha tenido mejoras en la condición económica.
texts.en:
Juan’s starting new work in agriculture and to do so will buy the necessary supplies like manure, herbicide and pesticide.  He’s asking for a new loan to make this purchase.  With this contribution he’ll be starting out with all supplies on-hand.

He considers that his work in agriculture is improving with the farm supplies he applies since he has everything needed to work and grow.  His family's economic condition has improved.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo, necesita dinero para invertir para el cultivo de granos básicos, comprando con los fondos prestados abono y herbicidas, tambien pago de mano de obra, con esto podrá comenzar a realizar su labor en la agricultura.
El está agradecido, porque ha tenido buenas experiencias en los prestamos, por eso tiene varios ciclos trabajando para poder mantenerse cultivando, porque de este trabajo ayuda a su familia, con la alimentación y vestuario así como otras necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Wilfredo needs money to invest in basic grain crops.  He will use the borrowed money to buy manure and herbicide and also to pay labor costs.  With this he’ll be able to start working in agriculture.

He’s grateful because he’s had good experiences with the loans which is why he’s been in several loan cycles working to continue growing because this work helps to provide food and clothing for his family as well as to cover other basic needs.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
JOSE DANIEL

JOSE DADIEL ES ORIGINARIO DE LA ALDEA XESUJ PARAJE EL SAUCE Y DESDE HACE YA MAS DE CUATRO AÑOS  POSEE UNA TIENDA DE CONSUMO Y COMO ACTIVIDAD SECUNDARIA SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE GALLOS FINOS DE PELEA, JOSE ESCUCHO  DE FAPE Y KIVA POR MEDIO DE UNA FAMILIAR QUE TIENE UN CRDITO KIVA. EL DESEO DE JOSE ES PODER AMPLIAR SU TIENDA, SURTIENDO MAS CON PRODUCTOS NUEVOS COMO AFRECHO, CONCENTRADO, MAIZ, FRIJOL, GASEOSAS, JUGOS  Y MAS ARTICULOS DE PRIMERA NECESIDAD.JOSE TIENE LA GRAN VENTAJA DE QUE SU TIENDA ESTA EN LA ORILLA DE LA CARRETERA Y ES UN AREA MUY TRANSITADA,  JOSE  DESEA QUE FAPE LO AYUDE Y SE COMPROMETE A SER RESPONSABLE Y PUNTUAL EN SU CREDITO
texts.en: José Daniel is from the village of Xexuj, Paraje El Sauce, and for the last four years has had a grocery store; his secondary source of income is raising fine fighting cocks.  José heard about FAPE and Kiva through a family member who has a Kiva loan.  José wants to expand the store stocking it with more new products like bran, feed concentrate, corn, beans, soft-drinks, juices and other basic staples.  Jose’s great advantage is that the store is located at the side of the highway and it’s a very busy area.  José would like FAPE to help him and he commits to be very responsible and punctual with his loan.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and has four children.  Rosalinda is 60 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Rosalinda buys and sells rice to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more sacks of rice to sell at retail.

Rosalinda has been a new member of PMPC. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell at retail

loans.name: Hang Group

texts.en:
Hang, who was born in 1970, has three children. Her daughter is in the 11th grade, and the other two are married. Her husband, a driver who transports construction materials, earns 5,000,000 VND per month. Hang raises chickens, sells groceries and has an internet store business, earning 5,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month.

Hang joined SEDA's credit program this year and is now requesting her first loan for 5,152,000 VND to buy food for her chickens. Her dream is see her children achieve good careers.

The other members of Hang's group are the following: Thu, who was born in 1961, has one child. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to repair her chicken coop.

Dinh, born in 1956, has three children. She raises chickens to earn a living and wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy food for them.

Huyen, born in 1986, has two children. She is a worker who wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to sell noodles to earn more money after work.

Duc, born in 1990, has two children and sells wood to earn a living. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to enlarge her store of wood.

Sen, born in 1984, has two children and is a tailor. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy some water filters to sell.

My, born in 1964, has two children and is a farmer. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy some clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Gofrey

texts.en: Godfrey is a 32-year-old married man with two children, ages 11 and 9, living in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He sells beer, soda and spirits and also earns income from teaching and has rental houses. He has a challenge of customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to meet the customers’ demands. He has a personal goal of educating his children to attain degrees and a business goal of expanding his business to open up other outlets. Godfrey is requesting for a loan to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and spirits to sell.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en: Ha is a 44-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Ha and her husband have run a business making soya curd for the past seven years. She would like to receive a loan to expand her business by purchasing a greater quantity of soya beans to increase her production. She hopes that this will enable her to increase the turnover of her business, earn a higher income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater quantity of soya beans

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 57 years old and lives in San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two children. Editha has a store, where she sells a variety of products -- soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. She has had this business for five years.

She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP, to buy additional inventory for sale. Editha has been a member of PMPC for three years. She hopes to have more savings in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for resale in her store.

loans.name: Ricky

texts.en:
Ricky is 34 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has one child.

Ricky is a chainsaw operator and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan to be used in redeeming his pawned parcel of cocoland.

Ricky has been a member of PMPC almost four years. In the future, he hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming his pawned parcel of cocoland

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel used his previous loan to buy land to expand his plantation. He is a 32-year-old married man with three children, living in Kyenjojo in Uganda.

For the past eight years he has been growing bananas for commercial purposes. He accumulated capital from selling maize and beans and bought land, which he is currently farming. He faces the problems of seasonal weather changes, theft, high fuel prices, and transportation. He has a personal goal of buying a car for easy transportation and a business goal of trading in bananas since the demand is very high and his plantation is not sufficient for the market. Emmanuel intends to use this loan to buy bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working for a nearby company. Lan runs a business selling fresh flowers, which she has been doing for 13 years.

Lan is requesting a loan, which she will use to gradually expand her business by buying different kinds of flowers to sell to her customers at a competitive price. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Cunegonde

texts.fr: Cunegonde est une femme de 35 ans  mère de de famille. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Cunegonde is a 35 year old woman and a mother. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling fresh food (maniocs, plantains) retail according to the seasons in a local market for 10 years. She has a good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her clientele which she acquired with time thanks to her experience in this field. But she finds herself constantly with stock shortages because she is obliged to sell all her stock to be able to get more again. This is because of her small capital. She would like to buy a pick-up truck load of bunches of plantains to have a good stock which will allow her to better satisfy the constant demands of her clientele and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits to not only expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck load of plantains.

loans.name: Lovender

texts.en:
Lovender is a 25-year-old married woman with two children. She lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. She has been with her business over three years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. 

Lovender requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase harvesting equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 35 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to resell.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is 55 years old and married with five children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Saturnino operates a family member's business providing motor transport services and he earns 14,000 PHP a month. He has been engaged in this business over five years. He joined GDMPC in 2009, and now he has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie is married and has one child. His wife is working abroad. Ronnie is happy to manage his business as a cell phone retailer. He sells cell phone units, electronic load, accessories, and provides services in phones repair. With his good service to his customers, his stall is known by the public. Ronnie always sees to it that his cell phone units for sale are branded or original. Ronnie dreams to expand the business into a bigger enterprise. 

He is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase new units of cell phones, accessories, and electronic load to sell. He believes that this loan will help him in reaching his dreams.

loans.use: to purchase new units of cell phones, accessories, and electronic load to sell.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola, de 31 años de edad es una mujer que tiene claro que quiere en la vida. Desde niña su gran pasión por la cocina siempre la impulsó a soñar e ir en búsqueda de lograr su deseo, por lo cual decidió desarrollar su potencial realizando cursos cortos de cocina, debido a que la profesión estuvo fuera de su alcance por su condición económica.
A los 20 años de edad, quedó en embarazo y el padre de su hijo nunca se responsabilizó, por lo cual debió comenzar a laborar en diferentes restaurantes de su municipio, allí adquirió experiencia y posteriormente se retiró debido a que su hijo le demandaba mucho tiempo. A raíz de esta situación esta mujer vio en medio de la necesidad una oportunidad de crear empresa por lo cual empezó a elaborar productos como postres, mermeladas y comercializarlos en las tiendas y supermercados de su localidad. 
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la fabricación de comidas y adecuaciones locativas para la cocina de su casa con el propósito de aumentar su capacidad de producción y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Paola, 31, is a woman who is very clear about what she wants in life.  Since she was a little girl her great passion has been cooking; it’s always pushed her to dream and go out in search of reaching her wish which is why she decided to develop her potential taking short cooking courses because the profession was beyond her reach due to her economic condition.

At the age of 20 she became pregnant and her child’s father never assumed his responsibility which led to her having to go to work in various restaurants in her town.  She gained experience there and later left work because her son required much of her time.  Because of this situation, in the middle of all this need, this woman saw an opportunity to create her own firm so started making products like desserts and marmalade that she started to sell in local stores and supermarkets.

Today, she’s looking for a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients to make meals and to make physical adjustments to her kitchen at home in order to increase its productive capacity and generate higher profits.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Nila

texts.en:
Nila is a hard working mother of three children. With her passion to see her children become professionals someday, Nila works hard; managing her sari-sari store business and rice grinder in her stall. Nila’s husband is a hog’s raiser.

Nila wants to extend her services to her customers in the village and some nearby villages. She wants to operate a coconut grinder in the village for additional income. Nila wants to borrow 50,000 PHP to buy merchandise like spices, beverages, breads, and canned goods for her sari-sari store. She hopes to earn a higher income and operate the coconut grinder soon.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like spices, beverages, breads, and canned goods for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ngoc

texts.en:
Ngoc, 46, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a teacher. 

Ngoc supports her family by running a general store in front of her house. She started this business 14 years ago. She sells many kinds of food, such as snack foods, coffee powder, and confectionary. She also sells to people in her community, travelling shampoo packs, liquid soaps, and other household items. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and to set aside some money for facing difficulty in the future.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es:
Ramiro de 27 años de edad, es un fiel amante  a su oficio, la vegetación y los animales son su pasión. Poder disfrutar de un bello atardecer y compartir con su familia es el mejor regalo que la vida puede obsequiarle cada día. 
Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la producción agropecuaria, debido a que su familia ha vivido la mayor parte del tiempo en el campo. 
Hoy siente que ha llegado la hora de comenzar a materializar su proyecto de vida, desea comprar ganado vacuno a fin de mejorar la capacidad de producción de leche para incrementar sus ventas y poder convertirse en un microempresario.
Su mayor sueño es poder tecnificar el proceso de ordeño, para lo cual desea ahorrar y poder realizar esta inversión. Por el momento espera que su actividad mejore y poder ofrecerle a sus padres mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ramiro, 27, loves his work; vegetation and animals are his passion.  To be able to enjoy a beautiful sunset and share with his family is the very best gift life can offer him every day.

Since childhood he’s worked in agriculture and animal husbandry because his family has lived most of the time in the countryside.  Today, he feels the time has come to make his life project happen.  He wants to buy cattle to improve milk production capacity to increase sales and become a micro businessman.

His greatest dream is to introduce technological milking processes and to do so must save up to be able to make this investment.  For the moment, he hopes his activity will improve to be able to provide better living conditions for his parents.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 41 years old, married, and has three children. With two children currently in school, Mary Cris works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to resell, like noodles, shampoo, bread and soft drinks.

Mary Cris has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so that, in the future, she will be able to afford to finish the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to resell in her store, like noodles, shampoo, bread and soft drinks

loans.name: Wiliam

texts.en: Wiliam is a 50-year-old man from Ngoma District in the Eastern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $100 to purchase 21 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20.  He will reinvest the money he makes into buying more lights to earn more money for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To pay for 21 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Edgar Israel

texts.es:
Edgar, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su esposa en casa de sus padres tienen dos hijos los cuales están estudiando, es realizar la siembra en dos manzanas de terreno de maíz esto lo aprendió de su padre y tiene michos años en esta actividad.

Edgar, quiere invertir en la compra de insumos para realizar una nueva siembra, esto le ayudara para que su trabajo agrícola tenga continuidad, se comprara abono, pagara el arrendamiento del terreno, realizara la limpia del terreno y lo preparara con la semilla.

Su objetivo es encontrar las alternativas necesarias para mejorar su producción, ya que esto le beneficiará también a su familia puesto que dependen de él y a través de una buena cosecha tendrán el alimento necesario.
texts.en:
Edgar raises basic grains.  He’s 38 years old and lives with his wife in his parents’ home.  They have two children who attend school.  He farms two plots of corn, learned this from his father, and has been doing this for many years.

Edgar wants to buy supplies for a new harvest.  This will help him keep continuity in his farming work.  He will use the money from this loan to buy compost, and pay to rent land, and clean and prepare it for growing.

His objective is to find the alternatives to improve his production.  This will also benefit his family who depend on him.  He will have the needed food though a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr: Jeannette est une femme de 57 ans mariée  mère de 8 enfants. L'un d'eux va encore à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Jeannette is a 57 year old married woman and mother to 8 children. One of them still goes to school. She is a shopkeeper and has been selling fresh food (maniocs, plantains) retail according to the seasons in a local market for 10 years. She has good knowledge of suppliers, and especially of her clientele which she acquired with time thanks to her experience in this field. But she finds herself constantly with stock shortages because she is obliged to sell all her stock in order to be able to get more. This is because of her small capital. She would like to buy a pick-up truck load of bunches of plantains to have a good stock which will allow her to better satisfy the constant demands of her clientele and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits to not only expand her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck load of plantains.

loans.name: Maria Susana

texts.es:
María, necesita invertir en el negocio de las tortillas, por eso solicita un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de los materiales que le permiten realizar la venta: el maíz y la leña, este dinero será utilizado para comprar estos materiales por mayoreo.
Ella comenta que en su negocio le ha ido bien, que le han servido los préstamos para mejorar sus ventas, gracias a Kiva se encuentra en mejor condición, porque su familia se encuentra bien.
texts.en:
María needs to invest in her tortilla business.  This is why she is applying for a new loan to buy the materials that allow her to sell:  corn and firewood.  This money will be used to buy these materials wholesale.

She comments that her business has gone well, and that the loans have served to improve her sales.  Thanks to Kiva, she is in better shape, because her family is doing well.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Isabel

texts.en:
Ma. Isabel is 42 years old and single.

Ma. Isabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

Ma. Isabel has borrowed and paid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from the retail of rice.

Ma. Isabel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell like snack foods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, soap, etc.

loans.name: Tuoi

texts.en: Tuoi is a 59-year-old married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has two sons. He and his wife earn a living by running a general store, which they have been doing for seven years. Tuoi would like to take out a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages, to stock his general store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and increase his sales. He also hopes that through this loan, his business will generate a greater profit, help him to improve his family's living conditions, and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as foods and beverages

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao is a 37-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has 2 children. Her husband supports the family by working as a taxi driver. Dao earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 11 years.  Dao would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectioneries, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income that will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods, and confectioneries.

loans.name: Albertine Cézarine's Group

texts.fr: Albertine est une femme de 32 ans mariée mère d'un enfant de 6 ans qui va déjà à l'école. Elle a aussi 2 autres personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, tomate, piment, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un sac de pistache, de piment, de maniocs et des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Albertine is a 32 year old woman who is married with a six-year old child who goes to school already. She also has two other people dependent on her. She is a businesswoman who for 16 years has been selling retail her fresh produce (manioc, plantains, tomatoes, chili, palm nuts, and fruit) according to the seasons at a local market. She has a good understanding of her suppliers as well as her clientele which thanks to her experience in this business she has gathered over the years. However, she is constantly out of stock of certain products due to the fact that she has to sell all her goods in order to be able to buy more because she has so little capital. She would like to buy a sack of pistachios, some chili, maniocs and bunches of plantains to have a good reserve which would enable her to better satisfy the constant demand of her clientele and avoid being sold out. She will save up her profits to not only enhance her business, but also provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy a sack of pistachios, chili, manioc, and bunches of plaintains.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia C. is from the village of Labo, in Ozamis City. She is 50 years old. Cecilia is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business of planting and harvesting bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Cecilia joined GDMPC, to gain access to financial services that might help her to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Now she is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP which she will use to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional profit generated from the business, to improve the general living conditions of her family .

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, for her banana plants

loans.name: Monique Nathalie

texts.fr: Monique est une dame âgée de 35 ans,mariée et mère de 02 enfants .qui vont  à l'école. comme activité, elle dispose d'un bar-restaurant dans un quartier de la ville de 01 an environ. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. mais son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire toute sa clientèle qui est parfois obligée de se retourner vers la concurrence. Ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital .elle voudrait avec ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de boissons ainsi ses denrées alimentaires  afin de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle,  augmenter son chiffre d'affaire ainsi que son bénéfice e. les revenus générés lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille et aussi d'agrandir sa structure. elle a comme ambitions pour son activité de faire dans la vente en gros des boissons.
texts.en: Monique is a 35 year old woman, married and mother to 2 children who go to school. As a business, she has had a bar-restaurant in a neighborhood of the town for approximately 1 year. She benefits from good experience in this field, but her capital does not allow her to satisfy all her clientele anymore, and they are sometimes obliged to go to the competition. This is because of her small capital. With this loan she would like to increase her stock of drinks as well as her foodstuffs in order to better satisfy the demands of her clientele, increase her turnover as well as her profits. The revenue generated will allow her to better meet the needs of her family and also to expand her structure. Her ambition for her business is to sell drinks wholesale.

loans.use: to increase her stock of drinks as well as her foodstuffs.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is married and has one child.  Nancy is 47 years of age and lives in Poblacion Mahayag in the Philippines.  Nancy is a farmer to earn a living. She has been doing this for three (3) years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer. Nancy has been a member of PMPC for almost two (2) years. Nancy hopes to earn twice her current income with the help of Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Hue

texts.en: Hue is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as shampoos and confections to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.  Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increase sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as shampoos and confections, to restock her general store

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 34 years old, married, and blessed with three children ages twelve, nine, and five that she supports. She has operated a second hand clothes stall for the last six years making a monthly income of 12,000 KES. 

Joice has applied for her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET LTD., with which she plans to buy more stock of baby clothes for resale. 

The anticipated profits will be reinvested. Her future hope is to have a stable business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en: Cuong is requesting a new loan to buy high-quality food to sell from her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and sales, and it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy high-quality food to sell from her food stall

loans.name: Mara Estherlina

texts.es:
Mara vive en Managua trabaja como secretaria soltera se  caracteriza por ser una joven responsable en su trabajo y estudio con muchos deseo de superación.

 La joven visito ceprodel para la solicitar un crédito para cubrir gastos  universitarios de ella ya que actualmente cursa el cuerto año de su carrera profesional. 

  Agradece mucho a kiva y ceprodel por que con el préstamo que le otorguen le ayudara a seguir adelante   en sus estudios universitarios
texts.en:
Mara lives in Managua. She works as a secretary, is single, and characterizes herself as a young woman who is responsible in her work and studies and has a great desire to excel.

She visited Ceprodel to request a loan to cover her university expenses since she is currently in the fourth year of studies in her professional major.

She is very grateful for Kiva and Ceprodel because the loan that they grant her would help her continue moving forward in her university studies.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Thi's Group

texts.en:
Thi is the leader of Thi's Group. She was born in 1959. She has two children who have married. Her husband is a farmer. His income is VND 3,000,000 per month. Thi sells fruits and vegetables. She gains VND 3,000,000 per month. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 11,000,000 per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2013. In this first loan, she would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. Her dream is to let her children have good careers.

Other members which are part of Thi's group include the following: 

Ton was born in 1954. She has three children. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell. 

Nguyet was born in 1969. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy food for her cattle. 

Hong was born in 1971. She has two children. She is a worker. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to do carpentry.

Tuong was born in 1986. He is a carpenter. He wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy wood, to do carpentry.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teolinda

texts.es:
Teolinda de 48 años, es una mujer que lucha incansablemente por ofrecerles a sus dos hijos mejores oportunidades de vida. Por su falta de educación esta mujer no tuvo la oportunidad de ingresar al medio laborar, por lo cual desde hace tres años se dedicó a la venta de café, cigarrillos, dulces y mecatos recorriendo las calles de su localidad. Labora diariamente de tres a ocho de la mañana en las afueras de un hospital  y de ocho a once de la mañana en el parque obrero del municipio de Itagüí, Colombia. De esta forma, esta mujer se rebusca cada día el alimento para su hogar.
Gracias a su subempleo ha podido ofrecerles a sus hijos educación. 
En la actualidad espera mejorar su situación económica, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía, una sombrilla y realizar reparaciones al coche en donde transporta sus productos. Con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Teolinda, age 48, is a woman who struggles tirelessly to give her two children better life opportunities.  Due to a lack of education, this woman did not have the chance to enter the work force.  Therefore, three years ago she decided to sell coffee, cigarettes, candy, and snacks by going from street to street in her area.

She works every day from three until eight in the morning outside of a hospital.  She works from eight until eleven in the morning at the Parque Obrero in the municipality of Itagüí, Colombia.  This is the way that this woman seeks, each day, to feed her household.

Thanks to her work in the informal sector, she has been able to give her children an education.

She currently hopes to improve her financial situation.  In order to do so, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and an umbrella and to make repairs to the vehicle in which she transports her products.  She will do this in order to improve sales and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to repair her vehicle.

loans.name: María Camila

texts.es:
“Cuando la sociedad te rechaza sientes que la existencia no tiene sentido, pero con el tiempo he logrado comprender que existen palabras que no valen la pena recibir” Con esta frase, María Camila de 21 años de edad, cuenta los inconvenientes que le ha ocasionado develar a la sociedad su verdadera orientación sexual. 
Este joven transexual vive en el municipio de Itagüí y desde hace dos años es estilista, actividad que aprendió gracias a unos amigos. Decidió perfeccionar el oficio, por lo cual ingresó  a una academia en donde se graduó como estilista. Ha laborado en varios salones de belleza, pero hoy busca independizarse y convertirse en el administrador de su propio negocio, por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de lava-cabezas y cosméticos.
Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su situación financiera y ofrecerles a sus padres una estabilidad económica, garantizándoles una vida digna.
Espera que con su trabajo se le abran muchas puertas y tener la oportunidad participar en grandes eventos a nivel nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
“When you are rejected by society, you feel like life is meaningless. Over time I have come to understand that there are words that are not worth internalizing.”  These words convey the problems that María Camila, 21, has had upon revealing her true sexual orientation to society.

María Camila is a transgender woman who lives in the town of Itagüí and has been a stylist for two years. She learned this profession from some friends and decided to improve her skills so she enrolled in an academy where she graduated as a stylist. She has worked in various beauty salons, but now wants to be independent and own her own business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to invest in shampoo chairs and cosmetics.

Her biggest dream is to be able to improve her financial situation and give her parents some economic stability, ensuring a decent life for them.

She is hoping that many doors will open for her professionally and that she will have the opportunity to take part in large national and international events.

loans.use: purchase shampoo chairs and cosmetics.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine is 53 years old and lives in Sevan city. She is involved in the trade of fruits and vegetables, for which she rents a shop. The income of her trading business helps her to provide for the needs of her family without support from anybody. Karine is divorced and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and two grandchildren. All of her family members are unemployed, and that’s why Karine works hard to obtain a means of living.
 
Karine has a high education; she is a Philologist. She worked in a glass insulation factory as a weaver for more than 8 years, but after the destruction of the Soviet Union many factories were closed and Karine became jobless. That period was the hardest in her life and it seemed like a stalemate. But she is a strong person and soon she started her own trading business. Step-by-step her business activity developed and now her trading is going well.    
Karine is asking Kiva for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian Dram to expand her business by adding a variety of goods (fruits and vegetables) to her shop.

loans.use: to expand her business by adding a variety of goods (fruits and vegetables) to her shop

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her three children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For ten years, she has been working in the business of selling vegetables.

Lien would like a loan to purchase a great variety of vegetables for selling. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties her family may face.

loans.use: to purchase a great variety of vegetables for selling

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of food ingredients. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increase sales, and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of food ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cows' legs to make gelatin.

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: Doña María Martha es madre soltera de 6 hijos siendo los menores de 10 y 14  años a su cargo, los mayores trabajan y apoyan a su madre económicamente, el negocio de ella es hacer y vender tortillas con esos ingresos desde hace muchos años ha mantenido a sus hijos y se ha apoyado en pagar sus créditos los cuales ha utilizado en mejoras de su hogar, lo último que hizo fue enverjar el frente de su casa, ahora quiere cambiar el techo de la sala comprando laminas de zinc, perlines y pagar la mano de obra, espera contar siempre con el apoyo de financiamiento para continuar mejorando su vivienda y así sentirse más segura con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María Martha is a single mother of six children. The youngest ones, ages 10 and 14, are under her care. Her older children work and support their mother financially. María’s business involves making and selling tortillas. With the income she earned over many years, she has been able to support her children and pay off the loans that have been used for home improvements. Her last loan was used to enclose the front of her house.

Now she wants to replace the roof over her living room, so she will buy zinc sheets, crossbeams, as well as pay for labor. María hopes to always have the support of loans so that she can continue making improvements to her home, which will make her family feel more safe.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets, crossbeams, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 63 years old, married, and has grown children.

Beatrice has a farming business that she has been running for the past 10 years and has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD., to enable her to buy seedlings, chemicals, and fertilizers to use in her farm.

She hopes to buy a piece of land and be able to build a bigger house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, chemicals, and fertilizers to use in her farm

loans.name: Lagrimas

texts.en:
Lagrimas is married and works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bread, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries.

Lagrimas has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lagrimas aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bread, soft-drinks, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Vang

texts.en: Vang is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food products to sell at higher margins. This purchase will help her to attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall, increase sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to attract more customers and sell at higher margins

loans.name: Dúo San Luis Group

texts.es:
Dúo SaN Luis 
Doña Marcela de 28 años de edad quien atiende  todos los días la venta de todo tipo de candelas y veladoras San Luis ubicado en el interior del mercado municipal de San Juan Sacatepéquez lugar donde ella logra vender candelas y veladoras entre otros artículos que junto a su hermano elabora  es su domicilio, gracias a la atención y el punto donde ubica su negocio  doña Marcela logra tener bonitas ventas y  a la vez buenas ganancias, que ella utiliza para  la construcción de su casa, como también vuelve a invertir y así lograr captar más clientes en varias aldeas y caseríos de manera ambulante  con el apoyo de su hermano mayor, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de preductos para elaborar candelas y veladoras.
texts.en:
Dúo San Luis 
Marcela is 28 years old. She works everyday selling all types of candles. San Luis is located inside the San Juan Sacatepéquez town market. This is where she sells her candles as well as other products that she makes with her brother in her home.
