His future plan is to buy a plot for building business premises and open a motorcycle spares shop for his wife.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Sharifan

texts.en:
Ms Sharifan is 48 years old. She is a married woman and a mother of four children. She has been successfully running a small general store for the last seven years at the corner of her house. Today, she has become famous in her community for running a store that provides perishables to many households. She counts a good client list and makes enough to bear the expenses of her family members. Her son also assists her in dealing with customers. 

In order to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets, and sugar from the market at wholesale rates, she applied for a loan of Rs. 20000. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to increase her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets, and sugar from the market at wholesale rates.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es: Leonardo, de 25 años de edad, esta casado y vive con su esposa en una colonia suburbana de San Pedro Sula.  Leonardo lleva 3 años de dedicarse a vender mercadería como es la prestobarba, superglu, yilet, cepillos dentales, resistolito, baterías, y otra achinería.  El anteriormente trabajaba como motorista de buses y decidió establecer su propio negocio.  Vende en forma ambulante. Distribuye el producto por cajas y por docenas. Con el préstamo que solicita que es por 7000 lempiras, quiere surtir su inventario de productos como presto barba, superglu y otra achineria que necesita para mantener surtido. Su plan es establecer el negocio en un local fijo en su casa. Agradece el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 25 years old and married.  He lives with his wife in a suburban neighborhood of San Pedro Sula.  For three years Leonardo has been selling merchandise like disposable razors, superglue, tooth brushes, school glue, batteries, and other items.

He used to work as a bus driver, but he decided to establish his own business.  He sells in an itinerant manner, and he distributes the products by the case and by the dozen.

He wants to use the requested loan for 7000 lempiras to stock his inventory.  He will buy products like disposable razors, superglue, and other items that he needs to keep in stock.  His plan is to establish the business in a fixed location in his house.  He is grateful for the support that was given.

loans.use: to buy cases of disposable razors, superglue, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Rigoberto, tiene 47  años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposa y  un hijastro en el municipio de San Luis Comayagua.  Rigoberto estuvo varios años en el extranjero y luego regreso para estar con su familia y hace 6 meses decidió establecer su propio negocio de pulpería, para vender productos alimenticios. Vende azúcar, frijoles, arroz, manteca, jabón, pampers, churros, carnes, productos enlatados, pastillas y otros. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado por 24,000 Lempiras, quiere surtir el negocio para incrementar las ventas y que los clientes encuentren de todo lo necesario en un solo lugar, también del préstamo quiere comprar estantes de madera para colocar más producto para vender. Pues su meta es lograr sobrevivir con el negocio y hacer que crezca poco a poco.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, age 47, has two children.  He lives with his wife and a stepson in the San Luis Comayagua municipality.  Rigoberto was abroad for several years.  He then returned to be with his family.  Six months ago he decided to establish his own business.  He established a grocery store to sell food products.  He sells sugar, beans, rice, shortening, soap, Pampers, churros, meat, canned goods, over the counter pills, and others.

He wants to use the requested 24,000 lempiras to stock the business.  He will do this in order to increase sales and so that the customers will find everything they need in one place.  He also wants to use the loan to buy wooden shelves to put out more products to sell.  His goal is to manage to survive in the business and to make it grow little by little.

loans.use: to buy food products, cleaning products, and wooden shelving.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, tiene  47 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive junto a sus dos hijos en el municipio de Esparta Atlántida. Ella es muy emprendedora anteriormente elaboraba y vendía lácteos y hace 4 años se dedica a la  venta de golosinas, refrescos, churros y comidas. También tiene cría y engorde de pollos para vender de donde obtiene otros ingresos. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos en ODEF, el actual es el catorce ciclo y es por 13,000 Lempiras, con este préstamo va comprar refrescos, churros y  los insumos para elaborar la comida para la venta. Su meta es crecer el negocio y obtener mayores ganancias para bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Julia, age 47, is a single mother.  She lives with her two children in the Esparta Atlántida municipality.  She is very enterprising.  She used to make and sell dairy products.  She has been selling candy, soft drinks, churros, and food for four years.  She also raises and fattens chickens to sell.  By doing so she gets another income.

She has requested several loans from ODEF.  This current request is her fourteenth cycle, and it is for 13,000 lempiras.  She will use this loan to buy soft drinks, churros, and supplies to make food to sell.  Her goal is to grow the business and to get greater income for her personal well-being and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, and supplies to make food to sell.

loans.name: Parwin's Group

texts.en:
Parwin is a 42-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and a mother of three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Parwin is one of the many Iraqi women who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Parwin has eight years experience with a small, home-based sewing and tailoring activity, a little business she tries to constantly improve. In the past, Parwin took a loan from Relief International-Microfinance Iraq, which she used for buying an over machine, some small furniture items and an iron with ironing board. Having successfully repaid the loan, she is now taking a new loan to further enhance her creativity options and also to improve her work conditions. She plans to buy a pattern machine and a small A/C unit and also to renew her work area.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor and thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about these borrowers has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to buy a pattern machine, a small A/C unit and also renew her work area.

loans.name: Santos Ramona

texts.es:
La señora Santos Ramona esta casada, tiene 49 años de edad, curso los 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 de los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al bordado de blusas, típicas, inicio este negocio por iniciativa propia, y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica a la fabricación de muebles.

Solicita un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de insumos necesarios para su trabajo, telas e hilos de diferentes clases y colores, espera que su negocio siga creciendo y sea reconocido en toda la región donde vive.
texts.en:
Santos Ramona is a 49-year old woman, married and mother of three children, two of whom are studying. She studied three years of primary education and makes a living from the embroidery of traditional blouses. She took the initiative to start this business and, as of today, she has four years of experience. She counts on the support of her husband, who works in furniture manufacturing. 

She is requesting a loan to buy the necessary supplies for her job: fabrics and threads of different kinds and colors. She expects her business to continue
expanding and to become known in the region where she lives.

loans.use: to buy supplies to embroider.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Mumtaz is 43 years old, vigorous, and married with six children. Two of her daughters assist her in her work. For the past 13 years, Mumtaz has run a hand-embroidery business. She is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads.  Mumtaz is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong.  

Mumtaz is requesting a 25,000 PKR loan to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls of various colors and in large quantities to meet with her increasing demand. In the future, she dreams of running a training center for the girls of her community. Mumtaz would like to teach embroidery skills so her students can help her to expand her business and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: to buy materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls of various colors and quantities
